loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda B., 55 years old, is married with 5 children and lives in Camanga Village, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur.

Winefreda has been engaged in her garden business for years, currently earning PHP 4,500 per month. She joined Paglaum MPC last year with a previous loan of PHP 3,000. She is now on her 3rd loan and has applied for PHP 5,000 which she will use as capital in her garden business to buy fertilizer. The profit she generates from her garden will be used as their livelihood.

loans.use: To use as capital for her garden busines and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Bebeliza

texts.en:
Bebeliza P. is a resident of Sebucao, Dumalinao, Zambaonga del Sur. She is now 53 years old, a widow with eight children and lives with her common-law husband who is helping her business. Four of her daughters have left to go abroad for a living.

Bebeliza loaned PHP 9,000 from Paglaum as additional capital for her business. Her business is progressing and she is now earning more than PHP 6,000 a month. Most of her clients are her neighbors and some are from the community. She dreams of sustaining her business with Paglaum as her financing partner.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Cataggaman Viejo is near Tuguegarao city proper. No wonder many of the residents here choose to operate tricycle transport for their livelihood. The family of Rosemarie is among the residents who depend on tricycle operation as their source of income. Her husband is the one who drives their tricycle.  

Rosemarie would like to borrow PHP12,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of their motorcycle, including their license renewal. Rosemarie is 36 years old and married to Lamberto. They are blessed with three children who are studying in high school and the elementary level of education. Rosemarie hopes that through their humble business, they will someday send all their children to college.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia belongs to a poor family. Her parents were farmers and, because of their poor living situation, she was not able to finish her studies. However, despite this, Sonia feels the blessings that God is giving her family. She is married to Bonifacio Jr., but her husband is unable to work because he is already disabled. Because of this, Sonia became the sole provider of their family.

Sonia manages a motorcycle transport business. She lets her relative drive her motorcycle and remit a daily transport fee of PHP 200 to her. Income gained from the motorcycle already has been a big help, said Sonia. She wants the motorcycle to operate daily. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 for the maintenance of their transportation vehicle.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of their motorcycle

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is only 25 years old. He manages a two-hectare (5-acre) farm lot planted with corn and rice. Arsenio is still single and chooses to help his parents first before settling down. His family lives in the village of San Vicente of Angadanan, Isabela.

The place was poor and far from access to market amenities. Arsenio is hoping to borrow PHP 23,000 from Kiva lenders as additional working capital for his farm since his income from the previous harvest is no longer enough to sustain his farming.

Arsenio patiently is doing his best in order to help his parents overcome the hardships of life. Sometimes, Arsenio also manages to operate a tricycle transport as another source of income.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en:
Catalino M. is a simple farmer, 42 years old. He plants corn and rice which are the major products in his village. He is now requesting to borrow PHP 28,000 in order to have enough capital for his farming business and to be able to avoid a loan from capitalists with big interest rates. He is hoping that, through this amount, he will probably generate a higher yield.

Catalino is married to Marivic and they are gifted with four children: Marvin - 19 years old, a high school graduate; Michelle - 17 years old, also a high school graduate; Mark Anthony - 15 years old, an elementary graduate; and their youngest, Claire - 12 years old, a high school freshmen student. Catalino prays for the best for his children and for the progress of their daily living.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Constancio

texts.en:
Constancio is 49 years old and is married to Jessica. The couple help each other in maintaining their corn and rice farming business to combat life difficulties. They are blessed with four children: Joseph - 19 years old, a baker; John – 16 years old, and still in grade school; Texso - 15 years old, who is not studying; and Joan - 13 years old, who is helping them earn a living through vegetable vending. The family is living in the village of San Vicente in Angadanan, Isabela.

Constancio is requesting to borrow PHP 23,000 from Kiva lenders as farming capital for this planting season. He will buy fertilizers, a bag of seed and hire farm laborers to cultivate and plant crops. Constancio is working hard towards the development of his farming and their family living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 30 years old and still single. He is a resident of Barangay San Vicente of Angadanan, Isabela. He lives there with his mother and nephews. He serves as the breadwinner of the family, working hard for the family and hoping to get married soon.  

Aside from farming, he is also engaged in fishing to generate another source of income to support some of their immediate needs. Due to lack of capital, Jessie decided to borrow a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP17,000. He wants to earn more profit for the future welfare of his family. He further said,  “Never, ever quit. In times of trials, keep guided and struggle for success and stay faithful on Him.”

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel A. is borrowing PHP 23,000 from Kiva lenders as additional working capital for his farming business. He is married to Rosemalyn and they have three children. They reside in the peaceful, but distant village of Baranggay San Vicente in Angadanan, Isabela. 

Joel manages three hectares (7.5 acres) of farm lot owned by his father-in-law. He also maintains a banana plantation that serves as another source of income, while his wife manages a village store. Joel hopes to become successful in his farming business and to be able to cultivate his own farm lot.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry manages two hectares (5 acres) of corn and rice field. He is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan from Kiva lenders to purchase agricultural inputs needed on his farm. He will also utilize some of the amount to pay for farm laborers who will help him during the planting season.

Larry is 41 years old and has five children: Rosemarie - 17 years old, a graduate in high school and who now works as a saleslady in Manila; the same with Ronalyn - 16 years old; Rico Yan - 14 years old is a high school sophomore; Ronel - 9 years old, in grade school; and Ruben - 1 year old.

With the assistance of his wife, Wilma May, Larry keeps struggling for the welfare of his family. They are living at Barangay San Vicente of Angadanan, Isabela, a rural and distant place.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario works as a farmer. He supports his family with his income from farming. He would like a loan of 20,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to purchase some fertilizers, insecticides and hybrid seed needed for his planting and farming maintenance. 

Mario is 39 years old. He is married to Ludivina, a housewife. They are blessed with four children. Lovely, 10 years old, and Mark Jay, 8 years old, are both studying in the primary level. Christian, 5 years old, is now in daycare and Gian Carlo is just 1 year old. 

Mario believes that a hardworking man can become a successful one. Thus, he is trying his best to become a hardworking man for his family who are the inspiration in his life.

He is shown in the photo (holding a hat) with the ASKI Loan Officer who visited him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides and hybrid seed

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando, 44 years old, is a local farmer in the simple place of Barangay San Vicente of Angadanan, Isabela. He manages 3.5 hectares (9 acres) of rice and corn fields. He is requesting PHP 23,000 in order to fulfill all his farming needs such as enough supply of seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides, and also his needs for manpower to make his farming easier and more productive.

Aside from farming, Rolando also helps his wife to manage her buy-and-sell business of banana products. The couple try their best to overcome different problems that come along in their life and they are thankful to God because of the blessings they receive every time.

Rolando and Helen are blessed with two children namely: Rhealyn - 14 years old, in senior high school at the moment, and Jamaica - 11 years old, who is still in the third grade of the primary level because she was in the late-development stage.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Rolie A. is forty years old. His wife's name is Gervacia, and they are blessed with six children: Jr - 17 years old, college student; Michael - 15 years old, fourth year high school; Carmina - 14 years old, high school student; Roger - 12 years old, elementary student; Jerome - 10 years old, elementary student; and their youngest, Jasmine - 2 years old. They live in the remote village of San Vicente Angadanan, Isabela. Rolie is doing his best to harvest a good crop of corn on his farm. He is asking to borrow PHP17,000 from Kiva lenders for his farming business. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and a variety of corn seed. Rolie's wife, Gervacia, has been engaged in managing a village store for almost three years. This business is maintained to help provide for their daily needs, for the education of their children, and also for some of their financial needs on the farm.

Rolie often goes into his fields to check and observe the development of his crops. He believes that in farming, hard work and patience is the best way to become more productive in the future.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is forty-six years old. His wife, Wilma, serves as a day care worker in their village. They have three children who are all in school, enrolled either at the high school or at the elementary level. His family lives in the remote town of San Vicente Angadanan, Isabela, where most of the people are very hard working and value camaraderie.
 
He is managing a rice field of 3.5 hectares. Farming is the family's major source of income, so Teodoro does his best to manage his farm well in order to bring in a good crop. Teodoro is requesting a loan of PHP25,000 from Kiva lenders to support his farming.  The loan will allow Teodoro to buy a sufficient supply of fertilizers, seed varieties, pesticides and insecticides, and to pay his labor costs. He hopes that through the program he can strengthen his business and become more stable.

loans.use: To provide business capital

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is married to Weslie, who works in a trucking business at Cavite. She is the mother of five, and they live in the peaceful village of Lullutan, Ilagan, Isabela. Their children are: Willy - 16, who has completed the primary level of education; Jessica - 13, and Leonard - 11, both of whom are in high school; and Ericka - 7, and Wendel, - 5, who are both in the primary level.  With her general store, Alona is able to provide the needs of her family and continue to send her children to school. 

To sustain her business, Alona is hoping to borrow PHP7,000 as additional business capital.  She is happy that through her business she is able to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen T. is from the village of Navalan. She is fifty-four years old and married with five grown children. To make a living, Carmen owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately $110 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carmen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby ducks to raise and sell in the future. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative) PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy baby ducks to raise and sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara M. is a borrower in the Semkini group at the Kihesa branch of BRAC in Iringa, Tanzania. She is twenty-three years old and single. 

Sara has been a food vendor in Iringa for one year and hopes to expand her business. She works for twelve hours a day and usually makes about $92 a month in profit. She wants to invest more money into her business and increase those profits. 

To reach this goal, she recently applied for and received her first loan from BRAC Tanzania. The loan is for 200,000 TZS, which is about $150. She will use this capital to improve her vending business. When Sara begins to gain extra profit due to the loan, she plans to invest it back into the business, so that it can continue to grow.

loans.use: To improve her vending business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon lives in Napisik, Sulipat Calamba Misamis Ocidental. She is thirty-one years old and married with one child. She owns and operates a business selling sand and gravel for use in construction. She has been engaged in this business for more than four years, earning about $90 a month.

Currently, Corazon is requesting a loan of 10,000PHP that will be used as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sand and gravel business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is engaged in a food vending business. The business has become a big help in supporting the education of her children. She is married to Romeo, who is a farmer, and they have nine children. One is already married, two are working and helping them earn a living, three are still in school, and some are still young. Having a big family is not that easy, Concepcion says, because it is accompanied by great responsibilities. 

She is thankful that she has been able to maintain her food vending business in their village. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request to borrow 7,000 PHP to further develop her business. Through the added capital, she will be able to increase her daily income, and she looks forward to being able to support the educational needs of all her children. Concepcion also dreams of expanding her business into a typical store in the future.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth T. is fifty-four years old and married with four children, both school age and adult age. She lives in Navalan Village, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has operated her business of picture wood lamination for five years and generates a monthly income of about $85.  She joined Paglaum MPC last year with a loan of 9,000 PHP.  Now in her fourth loan cycle, Elizabeth is applying for a loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use as capital for her business. The profit she generates will be used for family expenses and for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Capital for wood lamination

loans.name: Jess Magdalin

texts.en:
Magdalin is eighteen years old and lives at Green Valley, Tinago, Ozamiz City, with her husband and child. She is engaged in backyard farming, and started with the fattening of four piglets. She also wants to sell longganisa (spicy sausages or "chorizos") to her neighbors and friends. Her goal is to add to her husband's income.

In her first cycle she borrowed 5,000 PHP for her new business. She is now hoping that with the help of Paglaum MPC and through KIVA finance her small hog fattening business will someday become a big piggery for the future of her family.

loans.use: For hog fattening

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn M. lives in the village of Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is twenty-seven years old and married with one school-age child and an infant. To make a living, Roselyn is engaged in selling metal and other junk items from local community members' homes. Roselyn has been engaged in this recycling business for almost four months and generates income from these activities.

In 2009, Roselyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial help to improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Roselyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be Roselyn's first loan from PMPC.  She plans to use the profits generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn R., age 21, is studying in college while running a business to make a living. Roselyn sells loads and makes peanut rolls as her sources of income. Her husband is working in a microfinance company. She is from the village of Pinig, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. Roselyn is married and has one daughter. She has been in these businesses for almost two years and earns approximately 2,000 a month just from them but, of course, she has other sources of income.

Roselyn joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities of her own. Roselyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 from PMPC. Her previous loan was used to expand her business. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase wallet electronic loads

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina V. is from the village of Taboan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 34 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Gina operates a family member's business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Gina is just starting this business. In 2009, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
“If others can, why can’t I?” This is what Cristina A. voiced when she was asked about her principle in life. Cristina is now 46 years old and married to Zenon who is a foreman carpenter in Cabanatuan City. The couple and their children live in a place near the Cagayan River at Barangay Lullutan, Ilagan, Isabela. They are blessed with three children who are all studying. Crispin, their eldest, is now in college; the same with Melissa who was a college freshman; Angelo, their youngest, is studying in high school.

Cristina runs a variety store in front of their house. She sells various products to generate higher income for her family. She is thankful that, through the business, her family was able to survive the hardships of life. She is very proud that she is able to send her children to school through the business. She even goes to Pangasinan just to purchase fresh and dried fish to have sufficient source of income.

Cristina is hoping that, someday, their way of living will improve through her own sacrifices and patience. But for the meantime, her children’s education is her priority.  She believes that she can also make her business progressive just like others who are striving to succeed. To further develop her business, Cristina is applying for a loan of PHP 8,000 as additional working capital.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita T. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Balangasan District, Pagadian City. She is 43 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Pablita operates a family member's business operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal and other used-products in the local community. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. Pablita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional junk to sell

location.town: Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad B. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Balangasan District, Pagadian City. She is 39 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Trinidad owns and operates a business running a specialized retail store, primarily selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema M. is a 42-year-old married mother of four (ages 32, 28, 20, and 19) in the town of Iringa, Tanzania. 

Rehema has a small business as a food vendor and has been cooking and selling small amounts of food for one year now. She spends about nine hours a day working and makes a profit of 100,000 Tsh (about $77) each month.

Rehema is a member of the Semkini group in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa. This is her first loan with BRAC and is for the amount of 200,000 Tsh. She plans on using the loan money to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Jervie

texts.en: Jervie O. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Balangasan, Pagadian City. She is 21 years old, married, and has two infant children. Jervie owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. Jervie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig-feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig-feed and other supplies

location.town: Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana R. lives in Pinig Village, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old, married, and has three school-age and four adult children.

Viviana operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities. She has been engaged in her business for some years and earns approximately 600 PHP daily.

In 2007, Viviana joined PMPC to gain access to financial help to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Viviana is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in a refrigerator for expansion of her business. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenues generated from the business to pay education expenses and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for expansion of her sari-sari store

loans.name: Brasia

texts.en:
Brasia K. has a small business in Iringa, Tanzania selling charcoal and firewood. By working twelve-hour days, she is able to earn 60,000 Tsh, which is approximately $46, per month. She has been doing this kind of business for over five years and, especially since she has three children to support, wants to improve her business and her life.

By taking a loan from BRAC Tanzania of 200,000 Tsh, Brasia hopes to increase her profits and be able to put both capital and more of her profits back into her small business. 

Brasia is 35 years old, married, and her three children are aged 15, 12, and 10. This is her first loan from BRAC.

loans.use: To use for business expansion

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai A. is married and has seven dependents. He repairs electrical appliances and sells spare parts at Abotoase near Hohoe, which he has done for quite a long time. His wife is a trader. Abdulai uses his income to pay school fees for his children.

Abdulai will use the loan to buy more spare parts for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to reinvest to expand his business, to increase his capital base, and to increase his profit margin to enable him meet his financial obligations.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Sarfa

texts.en:
Sarfa S. is married and has six dependents. He makes car seats and room furniture for sale. He also sells spare parts for cars at Abotoase near Hohoe. He has done this business for a while now. His wife is a trader. Sarfa uses his income to pay school fees for his children.

Sarfa will use the loan to buy more materials for making car seats and also to buy other spare parts for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to to reinvest to increase his capital and profits.

In the photo, he is the one in the cream and black shirt. Those in the blue overalls are his workers.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making car seats and to buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. sells peppers, groundnuts (peanuts) and other foodstuffs. She has received no formal education. She is married and has six dependents and is responsible for paying school fees for her children.

Margaret has been selling peppers and groundnuts for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy peppers and groundnuts for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy peppers and groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. sells clothing and fabrics. She has received a junior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader. Gladys is responsible for paying school fees and other domestic expenses.

Gladys has been selling clothing since 2003. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice D. sells clothing and fabrics. She is married and has two dependents. She is responsible for paying school fees and other domestic responsibilities. She has received a primary education.

Rejoice has been selling clothing since 2004. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to yield more profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark O. is a carpenter by profession and makes and sells room furniture at Hohoe. He has received a senior high school education. He is married and has five dependents and is responsible for paying electricity bills and school fees.

Mark has been selling furniture since 2003. His loan will be used to buy more timber for making furniture for resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more timber for making furniture to sell

loans.name: Komla

texts.en:
Komla B. sells electrical gadgets and spare parts at Hohoe. He also owns a taxi which he uses to generate additional income. He has received a junior high school education. He is married and has four dependents and is responsible for paying school fees for his children and other domestic expenses. His wife is a trader.

Komla has been selling electrical gadgets and spare parts since 2004, but he started running his taxi not very long ago. His loan will be used to buy more spare parts and electrical gadgets to sell. He also wants to service his taxi but lacks enough money to buy spare parts to replace the worn out parts. He hopes to use the new profits from his business for saving and to reinvest to increase his capital and profits.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and electrical gadgets to sell and to service his taxi

loans.name: Nereyda

texts.es: Nereyda vive en el barrio linda vista en un barrio recien poblado de Nueva Guinea, tiene 2 niños , el mayor tiene  4 añitos y niña menor  tiene 2 añitos y  esta embarazada de su 3er hijo que muy pronto dará a luz,  su esposo trabaja como taxista  en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea y le ayuda con los gastos, trabaja en la Casa de Mujer desde hace 2 años y se desempeña como secretaria, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to crédito para Construir una habitacion en su vivienda y brindar mejores comodidades a su familia.    Nereyda en este año se recibio de la Carrera Informatica Administrativa, ella es una joven  profesional,  responsable, honesta, trabajadora, humilde,    su sueño es  tener a sus hijos con mucha salud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita  para que sus hijos gocen de mejores condiciones y vivan en lugar sano y agradable,  tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos economicos pero muy luchadores para tener un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
Nereyda lives in the recently populated Linda Vista neighborhood of New Guinea. She has two children, the oldest is four years old and her youngest daughter is two years old. Nereyda is pregnant with her third child and will soon give birth. Her husband works as a taxi driver in New Guinea’s urban center and she helps him with the bills. She has worked as a secretary in Casa de la Mujer (Women’s House) for two years. She wants to refinance her sixth loan to build an additional room in their house so their family will be more comfortable. She is young, professional, responsible, honest, hard working, and humble. Her dream is for her children to be healthy and to have a beautiful house so they can enjoy better and healthier living conditions. She would also like to have stable work to help her family as they have few economic resources, but are working hard toward a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Echarle piso a una habitacion y terminar de repellar

loans.name: Eufemia Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora Eufemia Nicolasa tiene la edad de 55 años, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, casada, sus hijos son mayores e independiente, una hija vive en Costa Rica le envía remesa y también recibe  una pensión del seguros social,  esposo trabaja como agricultor, los planes para su familia es terminar de construir su casa, ella trabaja como conserje tiene quince años de estar laborando, algunas dificultades es la artritis que tiene y se le hace un poco cansado. Con este crédito es la octava solicitud en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en frente de la casa y reparar el que tiene a lado que esta en mal estado ya que desea tener mejor seguridad. Sus objetivos es poder  conseguir mayor financiamiento para que su marido pueda cultivar sus tierras con mejores condiciones. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo y los beneficios adquiridos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eufemia Nicolasa is 55 years old, married, and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her children are adults and live on their own. One of her daughters lives in Costa Rica and sends remittances home to help supplement her government pension. Eufemia’s husband is a farmer. Their plans include finishing the construction of their house. After working 15 years as a janitor, she began suffering from arthritis and fatigue.

This is her eighth loan with AFODENIC. The proceeds will be used to purchase building materials to repair the wall in front of her house, providing greater security for her family. Her goals include obtaining additional funds so that her husband can cultivate and improve their land. Eufemia says “thank you” to AFODENIC for the assistance and benefits they have provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ileana Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Ileana Hernández, tiene 51 años de edad, reside en el barrio  Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, ella es docente de un centro que atiende a niños con capacidades diferentes lleva veinte seis años laborando para este centro. Su esposo es guarda de seguridad, tiene un hijo de quince años que estudia, sus planes es poder terminar su vivienda y poder tener una casa digna. Con este crédito va hacer mejoras a un cuarto en repellar paredes y embaldosar para poder estar en mejores condiciones. Con esta solicitud es la sexta el cual da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo y  los beneficios de plazos y  las mejoras para su casa que ha realizado. Sus metas es seguir contribuyendo con el desarrollo de habilidades y conocimientos de los niños para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ileana Hernández, 51, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She is a teacher in a center that cares for children with special needs. She has been working in this center for 26 years. Her husband is a security guard, and her 15 year old son goes to school. Her plan is to be able to finish her house and to be able to have a decent house. With this loan she will make improvements to a room. She will plaster the walls and put down tiles so that the room will be in better condition. This is her sixth loan. She is grateful to Afodenic for the support, the benefit of installments, and the improvements to her house that she has made. Her goal is to keep contributing to the children’s skill development and knowledge so that they have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make improvements to a room, put down tile in the living room

loans.name: Sheyla Dinorah

texts.es: Doña Sheyla P. mujer trabajadora que desde muy joven inicio su jornada de trabajo, su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos y prenda son siete años en las ventas el cual inicio para tener sus propios ingresos. Tiene 31 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposo es jefe del departamento de policía y tiene dos hijos uno de 9 y otro de 1 año. Este crédito lo va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer remodelación a su cocina, como repellar las paredes, cambiar el pantry. Sus planes a futuro es poder alquilar un cuarto para obtener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sheyla P. is a hard working woman that started to work since she was very young. She has been selling cosmetics and clothing for seven years. She is 31 years old, resides in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the city of Managua ,and started this business to have her own income Her husband is chief of the police department and they have two sons who are 9 and a 1 year old. This loan will be invested in the purchase of building materials to remodel her kitchen, rebuild walls, change the pantry. Her plans for the future are to rent a room to have an extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tu buy building materials

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es: El señor Bladimir Velásquez tiene 35 años de edad, tiene su propio negocio que administra junto con su esposa tiene nueve años de vender el cual inicio con capital propio, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua , su esposa de tiene dos hijos de 17 y 4 años de edad. Con este crédito va a comprar productos variados para vender en su pulpería como: granos básicos, productos enlatados, lácteos, gaseosas, jugos y golosinas para surtir su inventario el cual le generara vender más como obtener mejores ganancias. Sus objetivos es poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios, introducir nuevos productos de venta  a su negocio. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo para crecer en su negocio con la facilidad de plazo y por el desarrollo alcanzado de los logros para su familia.
texts.en:
Bladimir Velásquez is 35, and he has his own business, which he runs together with his wife. He has been selling for nine years. He started with his own money. He lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital city, Managua. They have a 17 year old and a 4 year old. With this loan he will buy various products to sell in his mini market. He will buy things like canned goods, dairy products, soft drinks, juices, and sweets to stock his inventory. This will generate more sales and better earnings. His objectives are to help his children with their education and to introduce new products for sale in his business. He is grateful to Afodenic for the support to grow his business, the ease of installments, and the ability to achieve for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, canned goods, dairy products, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias D. drives a trisikad, a manually operated vehicle which is an improvised bike, providing transportation services to local community members. Jeremias is married and has three school-aged children. He is 54 years old and from the village of GK, Santiago, Iligan City. Jeremias has been in this service business for over ten years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jeremias joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in improving the business. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement income of his family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve transportation business

location.town: GK, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
H. Trần Thị, 62, lives in the town of Ninh Giang. She is widowed and has one adult child. To making a living, H. owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  She used the previous loan to expand her business. H. is now requesting a loan of 10000000 VND that she will use to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. The loan will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Repair a transport vehicle used in the business

In 2005, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. She used the previous loan to purchase breeding livestock. T. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND that she will use to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be her fourth loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

P. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The business generates revenue primarily, though not exclusively, from raising cattle for sale.  P. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND per month from these activities.


In 2004, P. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. P. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund that she used to expand shelter for her livestock. P. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her 6th loan from the TYM Fund. P. plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Ninh Giang, Vietnam. She is married and has 3 adult children. To earn a living, L. owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The primary, though not exclusive, source of income for the business comes from from selling rice products to the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, L. joined the TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from the TYM Fund. She used this previous loan to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. L. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND, which she will invest in expanding her business. This will be her 6th loan taken out from the TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

X. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be invested in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from the TYM Fund. X. plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her restaurant business.

To making a living, M. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector; specifically, she raises and sells livestock. M. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND per month from her work (primarily from raising cattle for sale).

In 2008, M. joined TYM Fund in order to gain much-needed access to financial services and, in turn, to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Notably, M. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. M. is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 9,000,000 VND ($525), which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

Rosalie B. is from the village of Santa Filomina in Iligan City. Rosalie is a 33-year-old, married woman with one infant child. This is the first loan Rosalie is seeking via HSPFI. Indeed, Rosalie is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and its purpose is to provide reach out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao to provide financial assistance.

To make a living, Florin owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. More specifically, her main source of income primarily comes from operating a tailoring business. Florin has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.

loans.name: Mohmmad Ali

texts.en:
This is Mohmmad Ali the son of K. S. who lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 years old and he is married and has five children.

Mohmmad Ali owns a shop in which he sells different kinds of clothes. He has experience in this business of more than nine years. He would like to import nicer kinds of cloths from Pakistan which are more saleable in the market. Thus, he has requested a loan of 50,000 Afghani to enlarge his business.

Mohmmad Ali hopes to be the most successful businessman in the future. He would like to thank AFS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Irenita

texts.en:
Irenita E. is from the village of Santo Filomena in Iligan City. Irenita is a 44-year-old, married woman with seven school-age children. To make a living, Irenita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector; specifically, she sells home products. Irenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities (primarily from selling personal home products on a consignment basis to local community members).

In 2009, Irenita joined HSPFI in order to gain much-needed access to financial services and, in turn, to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan is the first loan she is seeking via HSPFI. Indeed, Irenita is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and its purpose is to provide financial assistance to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando G. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. He is 42 years old, is separated from his spouse, and has three school-aged children. Fernando owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily buying and selling scrap materials in his village. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Fernando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Abdul Samy

texts.en:
This is A. Samy the son of A. W.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 51, married, and the father of five children.

A. Samy is a vegetable-seller and has a shop in which he is busy working seven days of the week. He dreams to have a progressive business and to be successful. He has full familiarity with this business because, from childhood, he worked with his father.

A. Samy has requested a loan of 30,000 Afghani to buy vegetables which are in demand a lot in the market. 
He is glad that, through this process, he can improve his business.

loans.use: To purchasing more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Efren

texts.en: Efren T. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. He is 53 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Efren owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. He is just starting this business. In 2009, Efren joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: GK, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nasib

texts.en:
Nasib is the son of H. S. and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 and married with four children. He has a restaurant in which he sells different kinds of things. He would like to have a more progressive business and so he has requested a loan of 50,000 Afghani to purchase all the essential things required in his restaurant.

Nasib is thankful to all lenders, especially Kiva, that provide small loans to entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his restaurant

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 34 years old. She is a micro-entrepreneur and the mother of two and she is married to Reymundo, a policeman. Their children are: Ace Angelo, 7 years old and now in grade two; and Joker, 4 years old. Nida has a lot of dreams for her two children. She hopes that, with her patience and perseverance in running her business, she will be able to help her husband provide for the education of her children as they achieve their own goals in life someday. 

Nida is seeking the support of Kiva lenders in improving her general store business so as to be able to increase her daily income for her family, especially her children. She is requesting to borrow PHP 8,000 as additional working capital to buy more goods and other merchandise to sell in her store.

Nida also shared that she was already happy to see her children eat at least three times a day. But, as time goes by, she realizes that she could be even happier if they will also not only be given their basic needs, but also satisfy their wants to become diligent and consistent in their studies. She hopes that, through her business and with the help of our almighty God, her dreams for her children will be achieved.

loans.use: To buy more goods and other merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 57 years old and married to Julieta and they are happily residing in the simple village of Lullutan in Ilagan, Isabela. They are blessed with six children. All of them were not able to finish their studies due to financial difficulties. 

Pedro maintains a ferryboat business in their village since their place is just along the Cagayan River. He transports passengers using his ferryboat by crossing the Cagayan River which is the biggest river in the Philippines. With his daily ferryboat routine, Pedro is able to earn income for his family.

Pedro wants to improve his ferryboat that he uses in transporting passengers to and from each side of the river to get to their different destinations. Since his well-used boat needs repair and improvement in every part of the boat, Pedro came to request a loan of PHP 4,000 as financial assistance for the maintenance of his daily income activity, especially since it is his only source of income to support his family with their important needs.

loans.use: To repair his ferryboat

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn is the mother of five and she is married to Bonifacio, a helper in a hardware store in the town of Ilagan, Isabela. They are gifted with four children: three are now studying and one is a newly-born baby. 

Revelyn has been engaged in a general store business for more than twelve years. She ventured into this business to help her husband uplift their poor living situation. She aims to become a successful entrepreneur someday. To further do that, Revelyn is asking for the support of Kiva lenders to lend her PHP 8,000 as additional working capital to maintain and grow her business which will benefit their children in the future.

Revelyn hopes that her children will finish their studies in college and find better opportunities in life someday. Her children are all willing to complete their education with the hope to pay back the sacrifices of their parents and uplift their ways of living before they get married.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married to Alfredo, who is a ferry boat operator in their village. They are blessed to have three children, all of whom are married: Rogelio (39 years old); Reviline (36 years old); and Romana (35 years old). Rosalinda and Alfredo reside in the village of Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela. Their home is simple and is close to the market, but they need to cross the Cagayan River to get there.

Rosalinda helps her husband with their ferry boat transport business. Specifically, they transport passengers to and from their village to the town proper of Ilagan, Isabela. The business has become the couple's sole source of income to pay for their daily living needs. She is now seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP ($175) because their boat requires some maintenance work. Rosalinda hopes to sustain their business operation so that they can continue to cover their daily expenses. She explains that, even if they are a poor family, they can still live a normal life. She mentions that there is a saying on this point: “poverty is not a hindrance to success.”

loans.use: To maintain their ferry boat

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 33 years old and married. She and her husband are gifted with a daughter named Jessa May who is now in the elementary level. They are presently residing in Barangay Lullutan of Ilagan, Isabela. Sheryl wishes that her child will finish her studies until college so as to be able to have a good future someday, because she believes that a way to success starts with knowledge and, through education, knowledge is acquired.

To uplift their standard of living, Sheryl ventures herself in food vending in their village. She also sells barbecue in the afternoons. Lack of financial capital sometimes makes her business work very slow - thus her request to borrow from Kiva lenders the amount of PHP 4,000 as additional capital. She dreams to have a better standard of living. That’s why she is working very hard to support her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina, along with her husband, runs a ferryboat transportation business. Their boat, that is used in transporting passengers to cross the river, needs repair. Since Victorina has already paid back her previous loan, she is again asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders to be able pursue their daily ferryboat operation. According to her, the boat is already ruined, has holes, and parts are already old that need to be replaced. She hopes that their business will improve and that they are able to pursue their business and generate more income.
	
Victorina is married to Romeo T., a farmer. Their children are: Isidro, 30 years old, who is presently employed as a security guard; Rubelyn, 29, who is already married; and Nazarene. These three are all college graduates while their youngest is a special child and, because of this, he was not able to go to school. Victorina hopes that somehow, with their very poor livelihood, someday they will overcome the hardships of life.

loans.use: To repair their ferryboat

loans.name: Jobel

texts.en:
Jobel is married to Danilo and they live in the rural community of Barangay Aliaga, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. The couple only finished high school because of early marriage. They are doing the best they can to continue to send their children to school.

Jobel is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 for the maintenance of their motorcycle transport business. Through their business, they are able to sustain the needs of their family and, especially, provide for the educational needs of their children and also their farming needs. Jobel is also planning to engage in a vending business as an additional source of income to further support the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: To pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia E. is from the village of GK, Santiago, Iligan City. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Amalia owns and operates a food stall, making and selling food. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: GK, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita lives in Barangay Paunga Aliaga in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Alberto and gifted with five children who are studying in high school and at the elementary level. They want to send them to college so they can find a good job someday.

Anita manages a small eatery business in the village. Her husband helps to operate the business daily by cooking and assisting customers. Farming is their major source of income. She is asking the borrow PHP 5,000 to make her business grow.

She endures the hardships for their children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Betencia

texts.en:
Betencia O. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 53 years old. Betencia is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Betencia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Their main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Betencia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Betencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betencia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. -------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
“You will never achieve your goal unless you work for it,” says Irene I. of Barangay San Leonardo Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. After finishing her secondary education, she got married to Rey I.. They dreamed of building a happy family and a successful business. But having no stable job is difficult, says Irene but they are trying their very best to slowly achieve all their goals in life.

Irene manages a vending stall in their village, in front of their house. She wants to borrow PHP5,000 as additional working capital for their business. She hopes that with this financial assistance, and through hard work and patience, her dreams will turn to reality.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon runs a sari-sari store business (community based store). She lives peacefully in the community of Barangay Masaya Norte in San Agustin, Isabela. The place is situated along the mountainous parts of Isabela province.  Corazon is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 to improve her store and ablilty to satisfy her family and customer needs.  She is thankful for her husband as he helps her with the business.  Corazon is already 45 years old and according to her, she needs to have a bigger income to save for the progress of their family living.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline J. manages a general store in the village of Dabubu Grande in San Agustin, Isabela. Their place is surrounded by hills and mountains. She is 37 years old, married to Danny, a farmer. They are able to manage their store despite life's challenges.

Aside from managing a store, Evangeline is engaged in retailing gasoline in front of their store for extra income. She now hopes for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP15,000 to improve her vending business and become successful someday. She will utilize the loan to buy more stock, especially the commodities that every family needs. Evangeline is hoping that her children will have a prosperous living someday through her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen manages a sari-sari store business (typical village store) in her village. She is 34 years old and married to Rico. They are blessed with two children; the eldest is Christian Mark - 16 years old, fourth year high school and Lourie Joy - 15 years old, third year high school. She is thankful because even though she was spending a lot for their allowances, projects and tuition fees, she was able to maintain her store. However, she needs additional capital to buy enough stock of merchandise and requests a loan of PHP5, 000 from Kiva lenders.  She also hopes to engage in the vegetable vending business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 for her snack vending business. Marina is 45 years old and very determined to provide for the educational needs of her son who is 12 years old and in elementary school.

She wanted to improve her snack vending business to generate a bigger income for their daily needs. Marina also wants to expand into another kind of business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca sells glutinous snacks in her village in San Agustin, Isabela. She is 57 years old and doing her very best to give her family a progressive living, despite her age. She is married to Felipe who is a farmer. Her family is planting rice which is their common livelihood to combat life difficulties. Rebecca even sells vegetables when she does not have glutinous products to sell.

She requests a loan of PHP5,000 to improve her business. Rebecca is very willing to develop her business more and she believes she can make it. She hopes that lenders will support her business and she will do her part as a borrower.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma operates a direct selling business in her village. She sells personal items from AVON, NATASHA and MSE in Barangay Masaya Norte, over the mountainous place of San Agustin, Isabela. She is 42 years old and very determined to work hard for the improvement of her family's daily living. She would like a loan amounting to PHP5,000 as additional capital for her direct selling business.

Vilma is married to Generoso and they have three children who are Ralph Banny - 19, Hanz Alvin - 16 and Janna Kathrine - six. She hopes to give them a better future. The couple is doing their best to sustain the needs of their children and daily basic needs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice helps her husband maintain their furniture making business. She is married to Thomas and they live in the village of Allinguigan of Ilagan, Isabela where furniture making is the common livelihood of most residents. Alice is requesting a second loan for their furniture making business to grow and to finance the education of their children.

Having the amount of PHP10,000 will be a big help to their business growth and competitiveness, accompanied by hard work and patience.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is 28 years old and lives in Barangay Aliguigan, Ilagann, Isabela. She is a college graduate but unfortunately was not able to find a job. She is married to Christopher who is now working abroad. They have a seven-year-old daughter named Chrishelle who is already in grade three.

Michel is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used as added business capital for her general store. In this way, she can help her husband to earn a living. She further said that all their sacrifices in life are dedicated to the welfare of their child and future children. She hopes that her business will grow so as to have a stable business when her husband returns for good.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
“Time is gold” is the guiding principle in the life of Catherine U.. She is married to Antonio, who is a wood carver. They reside in the village of Allinguigan 3rd of Ilagan, Isabela with their two children. With their combined income, they have been able to pay for their family's living expenses and to send their children to school.

Catherine operates a variety store and a vending stall in their village. She is now requesting a second loan, this time in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225), for additional capital for her business. Catherine plans to purchase stocks of groceries for her store and for her vending stall business. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her request, and she thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by increasing inventory

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina C. has been managing and operating her general store business in her village for ten years. She is married to Eduardo, who is a laborer. They reside in Allinguigan Ilagan, Isabela, and they have six children. Due to a lack of financial resources, her children were not able to graduate from high school. Rufina patiently works hard to provide for their children, and she hopes that her children will remain healthy and keep their faith in God through the years.

Rufina is now seeking an infusion of capital in order to expand and improve her business. Specifically, she would like to borrow a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP ($275) to purchase more products such as coffee, sugar, detergent, and bath soap. Rufina notes that she has been saving some money to repair their house.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products (e.g., coffee, sugar, detergent, and soap)

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
“If there’s a will, there’s a way," says Yolanda N.. Yolanda is a 46-year-old, married woman. Her husband's name is Agustine, and they are blessed with five children: Imee (24 years old), who is married; Sheryl (22 years old), who graduated with a degree in accounting and now works in Cavite; Ferdinand (21 years old), who also works in Cavite; Val (11 years old), who is a high school student; and Ramil Jay (7 years old), who is presently studying in primary school.

Yolanda is engaged in the vending business. Specifically, she sells vegetables, fish, meat (e.g., chicken), and other snacks. She is now seeking a second loan, this time in the amount of 12,000 PHP ($250), in order to continue to improve her business. She has operated the business for five years now, and she explains that the income generated from her business has helped her family in many ways over the years.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
The need to improve his income and provide education for his three dear children is the reason Nabi B. is courteously requesting this loan.

Nabi is a very responsible and hardworking father who, for many years, has been dedicated to the business of buying and selling men’s clothes. 

Today Nabi is requesting a loan of $2,000 to expand his business so that he can generate more income for the well-being of his family. He is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more men's clothes to sell

loans.name: Sujaddin

texts.en:
Sujaddin Q. is 34 years old and is married with two sons. He sells home products and other foodstuffs in the market and has been in this business for fifteen years. This activity generates the main income for his family.

Since Sujaddin is very popular in the market selling fresh and tasty foodstuffs, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today, Sujaddin requests $2,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Shafakhat

texts.en:
Shafakhat A. is a 32-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his two children.

Shafakhat has a business raising and selling sheep and has seven years of experience in this field. Since sheep raising and selling is a profitable business, Shafakhat has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them and feeding and pasturing them.

Now Shafakhat wants to expand his business and buy more sheep, so he has applied for a loan of $2,000. Shafakhat thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 28, is single and a mother of two children who are in school. She lives with her children at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana.  She is a very hardworking young lady who has the responsibility of providing for her children.  She always looks up to God for help.  She sells ‘kelewele’ in the community.  Kelewele is prepared from ripe plantains chopped into very smaller pieces, wrapped with paper and fried with cooking oil. It has a good taste.  Kelewele is mostly eaten with fried groundnuts. She wants a loan to buy more ripe plantains and groundnuts to upgrade her business. She belongs to a community group called ‘Yehowa neme whefo’ which means God is my keeper.

loans.use: Buy plantain, charcoal and cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty O. started her fish selling business a year ago at Adawso a Suburb of Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She also sells food stuffs like spices, onions, pepper etc. by hawking. She serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and has a large customer base. She will hawk everywhere as long as she finds customers.

She is 30 years old, widowed and the mother of two children. Her husband died some years ago but says she is strong and moving on with life. Currently, her children are in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more fish and food stuffs to increase sales and income to support her children's education and fuel business growth. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Yehowa neme whefo’ which means God is my keeper.

loans.use: Buy more smoked and dried fish, pepper, onions, spices etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is 47 years old and is married and the mother of four children. Through hard work and dedication she has managed to cater for all her children in school. She lives with her husband and children at Adawso which is a suburb of Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana.

Mary prepares and sells gari and beans with fried ripe plantain (gari is a fried cassava dish), this food is popularly called ‘Red, Red’. It is enjoyed by many Ghanaians because the nutrients help build the body.

Mary has many customers because her food is very tasty and affordable to buy. This has increased the demand for her food. She is therefore requesting your loan support to buy more bags of beans, gari and ripe plantains to meet the daily demands of her customers. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy beans and ripe plantain for food production and sales

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 49 years old and is currently single and the mother of a child. Her child is a trader in the community market where they live. Ellen lives with her child at Suhum at the eastern region of Ghana.

Ellen works very hard to provide for her business. She is determined to work hard to rent a store so that she can sell rather than hawking (selling door-to-door). To achieve that dream, she has been selling cosmetics with products like spray, powder, lip gloss, blouses and shear butter (shear butter, or shea butter, is a popular natural face and hair cream), etc., and sells through hawking.

Ellen has been in business for four years now. She says the selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make enough income to rent a store. She is very sure that your loan support will bring her the desired results she expects. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Isaiah’.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and shear butter to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters who are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a security officer.
