Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. Elizabeth also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor all her children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. is the divorced mother of three children: two sons and one daughter who are all currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She is thirty-four years old. Sarah lives with her children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Sarah is a baker and bakes bread in her community. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks (travels door-to-door) to sell. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. Sarah desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is thirty-eight years old, married, and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Margaret is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a table by the roadside from morning to evening. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is fifty-five years old, divorced, and has given birth to eight children: one son and seven daughters. All are currently in school - senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Agnes trades in vegetables such as onions, garden eggs (eggplant), pepper, tomatoes, etc., on a table in the market square. Agnes also treks to other markets to sell. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and from Kumasi. She has been in business for over two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia O. is thirty-seven years old, married, and is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. All are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Emilia is a trader, trading in charcoal. She buys bags of charcoal from surrounding communities and sells the charcoal on a table in front of her house. She also supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy charcoal in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu H. is fifty-two years old, married, and has given birth to nine children: eight sons and one daughter. Some are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works with a security agency.

Zenabu is a food vendor: she prepares and sells rice and stew. She has been in business for over fifteen years and sells on a table at a local school compound. She buys her goods from Kumasi and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha B. (No. I) is forty-one years old. Her twin sister also shares the same name, hence, the numbering for clear identification. She is married and has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer.

Martha is a food vendor and has been in business for four years. She prepares and sells kenkey (prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kinds of soup and fried fish or meat). She sells on a table in the market square and also supplies to other retailers.

Martha buys her goods from nearby communities and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha B. (No. II)  is forty-one years old. Her twin sister also shares the same name, hence, the numbering for clear identification. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Martha is a trader. She deals in local soap manufacturing. She manufactures and sells local soap called ‘Alata soap’. She sells on a table top at the market square. She wants a loan to buy materials such as soda and oil. Martha also supplies to other retailers. She has been in business for two years. She aspires to expand her business and give her a children good education.

loans.use: To buy soda and oil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy A. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, four sons and one daughter. All are currently in school – junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works with a road construction firm while she is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is a staple dish similar to a sourdough dumpling. Lucy sells on a table top at the market square. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She also supplies to other retailers. Lucy buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for five years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua N. is fifty-five years old, is divorced, and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Akosua is a trader and has been in business for six years. She trades in food items such tilapia (a variety of fish), salted fish, etc., which she sells on a table at the market square. She buys her goods from Kumasi and wants a loan to buy fish and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fish and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Seis De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Seis de marzo” trabaja junto a pro-mujer hace año y medio aproximadamente, a la fecha el grupo cuenta con doce miembros demostrando ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
la actividad principal  de esta asociación esta basada en los alimentos, por ejemplo se dedican a  la venta de comida, venta de fruta, verduras, hortalizas, elaboración y venta de pan, elaboración y venta de jugos naturales, otras de ellas se dedican al tejido de mantas artesanales. La asociación Seis de marzo necesita de capital para comprar productos en mayor cantidad, con la seguridad de ampliar sus ganancias para obtener estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The “Seis de Marzo” group has worked with Pro-Mujer for about a year and a half. The group currently has 12 members and has shown itself to be organized with regard to paying back its loans and other internal affairs. The group's principal activity is around food production and sales: they sell dry goods and produce, bake and sell bread, and produce and sell fresh-squeezed juices. Other members weave handmade blankets. The Seis de Marzo group needs capital to buy larger quantities of products, knowing that increasing their incomes will help them achieve economic stability at home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Turqueza Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Turqueza” se reúne en el centro focal Villa Exaltación ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, esta formado por catorce  miembros, todos realizan sus actividades internas de manera responsable. 
Diversos son los negocios que tiene la asociación como ser; venta de material de escritorio y adornos en un bazar, venta de fruta, comida, CDS, dulces, galletas, otras socias tienen tiendas de barrio. Desean ampliar sus ventas, por lo que necesitan mayores créditos para la compra de productos en mayor cantidad, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
The Association called Turqueza (Turquoise) got together in the area around Villa Exaltación located in the city of El Alto. It is composed of 14 members who all perform their domestic activities in a responsible manner. The Association has all different kinds of businesses, such as: selling office supplies and decorations in a bazaar, or selling fruit, or meals, CDs, sweets, or cookies. Other members have neighborhood stores. They would like to increase their sales for which they need larger loans in order to buy their products in greater quantities. In this way they will generate greater incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Cristo Viene Group

texts.es: Hace más dos años, quince mujeres conforman la asociación “Cristo Viene”, están convencidas, que con una actividad propia pueden mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. La mayoría de ellas viven en la zona Villa Exaltación, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, venden cosméticos por catalogo, ropa, confeccionan polleras (Una pollera es una falda larga usada como vestimenta femenina, típica en algunas regiones de Bolivia), centros de polleras  y mantillas, otras de las socias elaboran y venden almuerzos  y otras meriendas en mercados de la ciudad. La asociación Cristo viene,  desea aumentar sus ventas, para esto necesita comprar insumos y/o productos y así  poder obtener mayores ganancias
texts.en:
Over two years ago, fifteen women formed the association “Cristo Viene” (“Christ is Coming”); they are convinced that by carrying out their own activities they can improve the quality of life of the families. The majority of the members live in the zone Villa Exaltación, located in the city of El Alto. They carry our various activities, such as, selling cosmetics by catalog, clothing, and making ‘polleras’ (A pollera is a traditional long skirt worn by women in some regions of Bolivia), ‘pollera’ underskirts, mantillas (head scarves), while other members make and sell lunches and other meals in the city’s market. The association “Cristo Viene” would like to increase their sales and for this they need to purchase supplies and/or products to be able to gain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and/or products.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn P. is a pig grower. She is 28 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband, Teofilo P., is also a farmer. While she is busy taking care of the pigs, her husband is busy tilling the rice field. This couple has been working very hard to be able to meet the growing needs of their family.

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed. The loan will truly help her improve her piggery. She is dreaming of buying five new piglets. She is taking every opportunity to improve her business and send her children to school.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. They provide their clients with training and insurance coverage as well as loans.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va H. is 23 years old and sells used phones in a local market in Prey Veng province. Her business has been around for about three years and she makes $5 US every day, while her husband is a moto-taxi driver who typically makes $3 US every day. Va H. has one young child who is not attending school yet. Currently she is requesting a loan of $1000 US to make a new investment. She would like to purchase a computer to transfer music into cell phones. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will enable her to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Tem K., 40, sells sugar cane juice from her home in Prey Veng province. She is married with two children who are still living at home. Her husband, pictured here, works as a moto-taxi driver. She typically makes about $3 US each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for $800 US to purchase more sugar cane to sell. Some of the loan will be used to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar cane

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam C. was born in 1968 and is a mother blessed with five children, one of whom is married and lives separately, while the others are still living at home. Her second and third children are single and employed.

Sam C. is married to Lay Souet, age 50, and they both earn a living by cultivating rice in the village. To alleviate the hard physical labor in the farm work, Sam C. will be using half of the loan to buy a water buffalo to plow the farmland. With the rest she will buy a boat in order to fish in Tunle Sap Lake. This will provide them with additional income.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo and a boat

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Y. Sao Yen, 40, and her husband make a living by producing rice wine and raising pigs to sell piglets. Sao is pictured at the place where she produces rice wine. She lives with her husband and three children. Two of her younger children are still dependent on her because they have years to finish schooling. Her oldest child has a business of his own as a motorbike dealer--buying used motorbikes and selling them for a fairly good profit.

For household improvements and future stability, Sao wants to borrow $1000 US to buy a stock of rice grains to sell when the right time comes.

loans.use: To buy rice grains

loans.name: Mary Kim

texts.en:
Mary Kim D. P. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Mary Kim is married and has three small children. To make a living, Mary Kim raises fish for sale. Mary Kim has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Kim joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Kim is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair fishing net. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Kim from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her equipment. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair fishing net

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem S., 33, pictured with her husband, is a fish-seller who lives with her two young children in the Prey Veng province. She typically makes about $1 each day and her husband, Kuy Sokoeun, makes about $1 each day as well, as a moto-taxi driver.

Chhem S. would like a loan of $700 to purchase a hand tractor (a rototiller) allowing her to begin a renting business. A hand tractor would increase their profits.

loans.use: To purchase hand tractor to rent out

loans.name: Morng

texts.en:
Morng S., 29, pictured with her husband, is married and resides with him in Prey Veng province. She works in a grocery store and also sells sugarcane juice, typically making $1 each day. Her husband, Som Pheakdey, operates a moto-taxi business and typically makes about $2 each day.

Morng S. would like a loan of $400 to purchase ice cake and sugarcane to sell.

loans.use: To purchase ice cake and sugar cane to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen T., 58, makes and sells baskets, making $3 each day in Batambong province. She is married and has four children living at home to support. Her husband, Duk Choam, is a soldier and makes approximately $1 each day.

Pen T. would like a loan of $400 to purchase rattan for her business. She will be able to increase her profits through making more baskets.

In the photo, Pen T., right, is pictured with her sister.

loans.use: To purchase rattan to make more baskets

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun Y. is a 42-year-old divorced mother who has given birth to four children, all four of whom are still young and attend school.

Hun Y. is a domestic rice trader. She also buys rice in bulk from people who live in the village and then she stores the rice in her stock supply in order to sell it to gain a profit.

Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Hun Y. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price is increasing.

loans.use: To buy more rice at low prices

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren C., 33, is married and lives with her four children in Batambong province. She sells vegetables and raises pigs and typically makes $3 each day but would like to increase her profits. Her husband is a farmer who also raises pigs.

The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Ren C. included. She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase fertilizer for the farm and to raise the pigs, increasing her current profits and prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong T., 45, is a natural medicines seller who lives with four children in the Battambang province. He typically makes $3 US a day, while his wife, pictured here, works in a grocery store also making $3 US of profit per day. This couple is supported by two of their children, who work as tailors. Dong T. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase sewing machines for his children. This is a purchase that he sees as a good opportunity to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gloria is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gloria runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 68 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and runs a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in her local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

--------------------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch M., 51, is married and lives with her three children in the Battambang province.  She works as a farmer and also makes fishing tools, earning approximately $5 each day.  Her husband is a fisherman and makes about $4.50 each day.  Two children work in garment factories.  Touch is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase a motor for her husband’s wooden boat.  She believes that this purchase will allow her to increase her income and support her large family better.

loans.use: Purchase a motor.

loans.name: Willie

texts.en:
Willie N. is a rice farmer and is able to support his family. He tills a 3/4 hectare farm and has done so since 1989. Every harvest, he regularly earned Php 24,000 to provide food, clothing and other needs for his family. He was driving a passenger vehicle before that but was not happy so he quit to manage a small rice farm instead.

He would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and chemicals. He thinks that by doing so, he will be able to improve his harvest and help his family more.

CEVI is a partner of World Vision Philippines. CEVI provides its clients with loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị N. is a 35 year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source comes from making and selling iron products to local businesses and community members. Nguyễn Thị has been in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month.

In 2005, Nguyễn Thị joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Nguyễn Thị has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000000 VND from TYM Fund to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND to expand her business. The loan will be her fifth from TYM Fund. Nguyễn Thị plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Expanding her business.

loans.name: Phork

texts.en: Phork K. is shown in the picture with her daughter. She is age 29 and lives with family members in the Province of Pursat, since 1979.  She currently generates income by selling pork in the local market from pigs that her husband slaughters.  She also buys and raises pigs to sell.  Phork K. is applying for a loan as capital to purchase the neighbor's mature pig to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: Purchase a pig.

loans.name: Edmarie

texts.en:
"I have been a farmer for 15 years. That is how I provide for my family's basic needs and for the school tuition for my children," says Edmarie D., 43 years old mother of three children. She also manages a small sari-sari store business. Edmarie wanted to open a small piggery in her backyard so that she will be able to send her children to good schools.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. The loan will definitely help her achieve a better harvest.

Besides the loan from CEVI she receives training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and supplies.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo P., 42, is married and lives with three of his children. He works as a taxi driver in the Battambang province, typically making $5 each day.  He is supported by his wife (pictured) who works in a grocery store. Three of their children are in school. To make more money, Keo would like to ask for a loan of $800 to add grocery inventory for his wife to sell to meet customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe T. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish to residents in the local community. Fe has engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase fish to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her second taken by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

--------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira P. is from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elmira owns and operates a buy and sell business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source comes from buying and selling crabs. Elmira has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elmira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional crabs to sell. Elmira is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional crabs to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elmira from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

--------------------------- About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: Purchase crabs to sell.

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
P. Trần Thị (649000468) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four school-aged children.

P. owns and operates a business providing furniture rental services to local community members. P. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2000, P. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

P. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 9th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen G. manages a small parcel of rice field. She is 48 years old and has four children. She and her husband work so hard to be able to raise their children well by providing them with their needs. She started farming in 1994 and the family is able to earn Php 30,000 every harvest. Now, she needs additional capital to run her business. She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm materials. The loan will really help her family sustain their livelihood. CEVI is reaching out to more and more people to help them to start and have a business. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm materials

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. K. and her husband. K., 29 years old, is a humble mother who has one young child who attends school. Since 2006, she has been cultivating rice on her farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. Her husband also works with her on the farm. Beside the current farming work, K.’s husband always goes to buy animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because the selling-animal business is the main source of income for this family, K. requested a loan of $1200 as capital for her husband to buy an extra cow and buffalo to sell.

loans.use: To buy a cow and buffalo to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (627981324) is a 54-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên.  She is married and has five adult children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a restaurant.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community.  N. has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1998, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.  The loan will be the 11th loan taken out by N. from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase food & drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda D. owns a small rice field. She is 49 years old and has seven children. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. Her husband, Juan D., is the one managing their business to provide all the needs for their family. 

She needs a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm necessities. The loan will also help her expand her business even more.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers to be able to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina J. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 41 years old. Rizalina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rizalina owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rizalina has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rizalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase a fishing boat. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rizalina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy A. is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Nancy is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nancy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nancy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Kung N., 45 years old, is a vegetable grower from the Pursat Province. She runs her business on her own farmland where she grows different kinds of vegetables like cabbage, potatoes, and morning glories. She has been running this sector for more than four years. Kung N. is married to Mr. Sout Ean who helps her with the farm work. She has seven children: six are single and one is married and lives away from the family home. This family has been planting their crops for three months but their crops still need fertilizer. Hence, Kung N. would like a loan to buy extra fertilizer to fatten her crop's yield. She, her husband, and their child are pictured.

loans.use: To buy extra fertilizer

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 40, is married and lives with five of her children in the Batambong province. She grows and sells vegetables, making US$5 every day. Her husband runs a moto-taxi making approximately US$3 each day. They are also supported by two of their children who are employed. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation struggles have affected all Cambodians. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, Seng S. included. The country’s economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country’s economic difficulties, Seng S. is seeking to increase her income and reduce her transportation cost. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo C. started having a business in 2002. He grows rice using a 2-hectare farm that he owns in order to save something for the rains. His wife Ma. Theresa C. is very much caring and supportive of him, especially in their farm business. So far, they don't have any children. They are still hoping that someday they will be a complete picture of a family with many children by their side.

Mr. C. is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm necessities. The loan will also help the couple start a new business since they have been aspiring for a duck farm livelihood in the future.

CEVI helps the couple sustain more than their livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Dib

texts.en: Dib S., 30, is married and lives with her husband in the Batambong province. Selling vegetables and pork, she makes US$25 in revenue each day and her husband works construction making US$7 each day. Dib S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase both construction materials, and vegetables and pork to sell. She sees these purchases as a good investment to expand her business and she is confident it will increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials, vegetables and pork.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (227080748) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Gia Lộc.  She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, L. owns & operates a restaurant.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Mrs. C., age 26, resides in Pursat Province, where she earns a living breeding pigs in a stall next to her house. She also sells a few grocery items in the market for additional income. Her husband works as a local ox trader. This couple has one child who is a minor and under their care. Because raising pigs is a profitable business for the family to invest in, Mrs. C. is looking for capital from a Kiva loan in order to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Beun

texts.en:
Beun S., 41, lives in the Battambang province with her husband and four young children. She grows and sells vegetables, making $3 US a day, and is supported by her husband who collects palm juice, making $3 US a day. Her family is aided by four of her children who are employed.

In light of these times of economic difficulties, Beun S. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who one day hopes to set up a grocery store in front of her home. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ma. Luzviminda

texts.en:
Ma. Luzviminda D. grows rice for a living. It has been her dream to always be successful with her farm by consistently having a very good harvest. She is 41 years old and has four children. She worked previously as a saleslady. Her family is able to earn at least Php 20,000 every time they harvest their rice.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She believes that by doing so, she will help improve their harvest.

CEVI helps small entrepreneurs sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P. is a farmer. She is 61 years old and still working very hard to earn a living to meet her personal needs. She is a widow and has four children. She has been engaged in farming since she was 31 years old. Now, she needs a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She thinks that by doing so she will be able to increase the yield of her farm.

CEVI helps her grow her rice farm business. CEVI provides its clients with training and insurance coverage services as well as loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G. owns and operates a sari-sari or general store selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. She is 51 years old, married and has seven adult children. She is from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Merlyn has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị is a 25 year-old woman living in the town of Gia Lộc. She is married and has an infant child. To making a living, L. owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 2,300,000 VND a month.

In 2008, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. L. is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

No. 227080750.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
Ching M. is 65 years old, married and has four adult children. She is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Ching owns and operates a sari-sari or general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste etc. in the local community. Ching has been in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ching joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ching is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie F. is managing a small rice farm. Every day, she goes out to the farm to till the field with her husband. They never mind the labor and the heat of the sun, just as long as they are sure that they will have enough food to share in their family. She is 29 years old and has one child. Josie and her husband have been engaged in farming since 2005.

Josie would like to borrow 6,000 PHP from CEVI, Kiva's partner in the Philippines. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm needs. She thinks that by doing so, she will help improve the size of their harvest.

CEVI is reaching out to people to help them start and maintain a livelihood on their own. CEVI provides its client with training and insurance coverage as well as credit assistance.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna M. makes a living primarily from raising pigs to sell. She is 43 years old, married to Marcelo, and they have four school-age children. The eldest child had to stop schooling to work, in order to help his parents earn an income. Her three younger children are now studying in high school and elementary school. They are from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City.

Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000  which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay for tuition fees and daily allowances for her children. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socioeconomic development and holistic transformation.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chay S., 59, has raised pigs in a pigpen behind her house for years, earning around $3 per day. She is married with three children, all of whom are married and have already started new family homes. Her husband is a rice farmer. He owns a hulling machine and provides his service to the rice cultivators in the village for a profit.

Chay S. will use the loan money to buy piglets to breed and a water buffalo to raise its future offspring for plowing the farmland.

loans.use: To buy piglets to breed and a water buffalo

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Thư Nguyễn Thị (227080496) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Gia Lộc.  She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Thư owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Thư has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Thư joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thư has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Thư is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by Thư from TYM Fund.  Thư plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: 14-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Khoa Lê Thị is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Khoa is the group leader for a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 14-Đông Sơn (10.13.14).




Khoa is married and has 2 adult children.  She operates a specialized retail store, and her income comes primarily from selling products in the local community.  Khoa has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2100000 VND a month from it.




In 2009, Khoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  This will be Khoa's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting 1626900 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  Khoa plans to use the additional revenue generated by selling these products to improve/expand her business.





About the Other Borrowers in the Group:




1.  N. Thị Lâm is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.





2.  N. Thị Tuyết is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.




3.  N. Thị Thuỷ is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.






4.  N. Thị Hoan is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.





5.  N. Thị Vinh is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.




6.  Vũ Thị Phẩm is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.






About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:




The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.





*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.





Khoa Lê Thị (253) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Khoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 14-Đông Sơn (10.13.14).





Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm đồ gia dụng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Khoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Khoa kiếm được khoảng 2100000 VND.  Vào 2009, Khoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Khoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1,626,900 VND.






Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

\pr\
\pr\


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

\pr\
\pr\


1.  N. Thị Lâm (251) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

\pr\
\pr\

3.  N. Thị Thuỷ (256) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

4.  N. Thị Hoan (254) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

5.  N. Thị Vinh (255) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

6.  Vũ Thị Phẩm (257) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
\pr\
\pr\

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

\pr\
\pr\

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
General store is the business managed by Anita D. of Barangay Sta. Rosa Gamu, Isabela. She has been managing the business for about ten years.  With the need to have an alternative source of income, she engaged in this business aside from farming.  She is thankful that the business is still doing better and helps them to support the needs of their family.  Anita would like to ask for support from lenders who could help her improve her business more. She needs additional capital amounting to PHP7,000. 

Anita belongs to a happy family and they live a harmonious life in the village of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Isabela. She is married to Ramonito, a farmer, and blessed with four children; three of them are studying.  Their eldest has already finished her education course; the second and third children are currently studying in college and their youngest is studying in the primary school. 

Anita always wanted the best for her children. She was glad that she made it all start right and she always believed that “success started from humble beginnings”.

loans.use: Business Capital

Y. Lê Thị (226080564) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of Gia Lộc.  She is single and does not have any children.  To make a living, Y. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Y. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 2,700,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Y. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Y. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by Y. from TYM Fund.  Y. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario C. is from the village of Anonang, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 53 years old. Mario is widowed and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Mario owns & operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling crabs and other delicacies in the local community. Mario has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mario is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offerings. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Mario from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for his children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
