loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria shared that “contentment does not mean getting all you want, but enjoying what you have”.  She is a graduate of secondary education and she formerly taught in public school in their town.  Due to the low salary rate, Candelaria decided to start her own business. She believes she can be more successful and productive.  She even worked abroad for two years in order to earn a bigger amount that she can use as her starting capital.  

She is engaged in selling hog fattening feed in their village.  Due to lack of capital, she now would like to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP17,000 as additional business capital.  She hopes and prays that all her ambitions and dreams will come into reality and become successful. 

Candelaria is still single.  She is continuously supporting her parents as well as her brothers and sisters who need her help.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Tuttiniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Туттинисо  с 2005 года кредитор в Микроинвест , она торгует на рынке Костакоза чаем (заваркой) .У неё очень большой ассортимент чая, чёрного и зелёного.Привозит она товар с оптового рынка Худжанда и продаёт в розницу.Для расширения и увеличения товара она хочет привезти партию зелёного чая №95.Он пользуется у нас большим спросом.Она благодарна Организации за финансирование и понимание.Туттинисо на снимке в день выдачи с "Арванда"
texts.en:
Tuttiniso has been a borrower at MicroInvest since 2005. She sells tea at a market in the Kostakoz district. She has a wide variety of tea, both black and green. She brings her merchandise from a wholesale market in Khujand and sells it retail. To expand and add to her product variety, Tuttiniso wants to bring in green tea #95. This tea is in high demand here. She is grateful to our organization for the financing and understanding. The photograph shows Tuttiniso on the disbursement day at Arvand.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tea

loans.name: Ni Wayan Suweli

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Suweli - (DNR.M-0702) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Wayan Suweli owns & operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Ni Wayan Suweli has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 750,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, Ni Wayan Suweli joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Wayan Suweli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 500,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  Ni Wayan Suweli is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the third loan she has taken out from DINARI.  Ni Wayan Suweli plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Wayan Suweli - (DNR.M-0702) merupakan 51 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 4 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Wayan Suweli memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor ritel.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuka toko umum.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan & barang kebutuhan sehari-hari di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Ni Wayan Suweli sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Suweli menghasilkan sekitar 750,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Wayan Suweli bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Wayan Suweli meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli peralatan & perkakas baru untuk mengembangkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Wayan Suweli berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
After the death of her husband, Florita E. thought that she has no more reason to live. But her nine children encouraged her to live. Good thing that she has a farm business that keeps her busy all the time. At least, she sometimes forgets to weep and mourn. 

Now, she is busy managing a farm. She wanted to make the farm productive in memory of her husband who was a good farmer.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm needs. The loan will help improve her yield. In that way, she could give her children a share to support their children also.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm needs

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 48 years old.  She is a good mother and wife to Leo Digarto who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children: Allan, Leodimar, and Amylun and they are all married.  They reside in a peaceful village of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Isabela at the moment.

Florita believes that while “there is life, there is also hope”. She said that while she is still strong, she will continue to pursue her business until it becomes progressive.  She is engaged in a small store and she also sells fruit and vegetables. She wants to make it grow and generate more income that will be very helpful to their family.  She would like to borrow a loan of PHP6,000.  Florita is also a woman full of hopes and dreams. She always strives to reach out for the goals in life that will someday benefit her children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham N., 44, lives in the Batambong province with her husband and four young children. She makes about US$3 daily, selling fruit and growing rice, while her husband makes US$1.50 in construction. She is asking for a loan in the amount of US$300 to reinvest in her fruit store. She is also hoping to purchase a pig to raise and sell with the money from the loan. She sees this loan as a great opportunity to expand her business and is confident that she will see her income increase as a result.

loans.use: To reinvest in her fruit store.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
“Don’t do unto others what you don’t want others do unto you”, is the guiding principle in life of Josie P..  She is 36 years old and married to Rodante who is a tricycle driver in their village.  They have three children who are all studying in the primary level. Josie dreams of providing her three children with a quality education.  

The tricycle that they are using is already six years and needs a lot of repair and maintenance.  She would like to borrow a loan of PHP7,000.  She will use the loan to buy spare parts and motorcycle accessories that they need for their tricycle to run safely.  Josie also hopes to start a business when she has enough capital to do so in order to help her husband earn a daily income for their growing needs at home.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Zarifchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Зариф кредитор в организации с 2003 года. За время кредитования он ни разу не нарушал условий кредитования. Каждый свой кредит он использует на расширение своего бизнеса купли продажи скота. Он сам таксист и на плохо зарабатывает на жизнь, но дополнительный доход на кому не помешает. Он уже десять лет как занимается куплей и продажей скота. Сейчас у него пять больших коров . На следующий кредит он хочет купить ещё две молодые коровы и корм для скота.
texts.en:
Zarif has been a borrower with our organization since 2003. Throughout this time, he never violated credit terms. He uses each one of his loans to expand his business of livestock sales. Zarif is also a taxi driver and makes a pretty good living, but additional income never hurts anyone. He has been involved in livestock sales for 10 years and currently has five large cows. Zarif wants to use his next loan to buy two additional young cows and feed for the livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two cows and livestock feed

loans.name: Ni Komang Wiriasih

texts.en:
Ni Komang Wiriasih (DNR.M-0703) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and does not have any chlidren. To making a living, she works in someone else's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting cocoa for sale. Ni Komang Wiriasih has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns ~250,000 IDR a month.


In 2007, Ni Komang Wiriasih joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 500,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from DINARI. Ni Komang Wiriasih plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Komang Wiriasih - (DNR.M-0703) merupakan 36 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan tidak memiliki anak.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Komang Wiriasih bekerja di dalam usaha milik orang lain.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membudidayakan tanaman.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menanam & memanen kakao (coklat) untuk dijual.  Ni Komang Wiriasih sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang Wiriasih menghasilkan sekitar 250,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Komang Wiriasih bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Komang Wiriasih meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Komang Wiriasih berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bobochon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Бобочон кредитор организации с 2003 года . Он занимается продажей чая (заварки).Привозит товар с оптового рынка Худжанда и продаёт на рынке Костакоза в розницу.У него увеличился оборотный капитал в несколько раз , с прибыли бизнеса он смог отремонтировать свой дом. На следующий кредит он хочет закупить 10 коробок чёрного чая.
texts.en:
Bobochon has been a borrower with our organization since 2003. He sells tea. He brings his merchandise from a wholesale market in Khujand and sells it retail at a market in Kostakoz. His working capital increased quite a bit, and he was able to use the profit from his business to repair his house. Bobochon wants to use his next loan to purchase 10 boxes of black tea.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of black tea

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna always reminds herself that “poverty is not a hindrance to success.” She is a simple woman who always strives to succeed through her patience and diligence in maintaining her vending business. She is a resident of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Isabela. She is 46 years old and is determined to send her children to school. 

Lorna is a vegetable vendor. Every morning, she buys vegetables wholesale from the public market of Ilagan and sells at retail price in her village. To further improve her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 as additional capital. She and her husband are sacrificing a lot to provide the needs of their family and support their children’s education. She knows that a positive attitude will help in reaching her goals in life. No matter how difficult life may be, she does not consider it as a reason to give up for she strives to become successful someday.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rous

texts.en: Rous T., 41, is married and lives with her husband and one of her three children in the Kampong Cham province. She has been selling grocery products for a living and earns around US$7 every day. Her husband stays at home and helps her in selling the products. Two of their children work in Malaysia and often send money to support the family. Rous would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products so that she can meet the growing demands of her clients.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
Мавджуда-женщина 48  лет.Вдова имеет 3-х детей.Имеет среднее образование.Занимается продажей парфюмерии и хозяйственным товаром.Так как его муж умер, она растит 3-х детей в одиночку и конечно же ей очень трудно. Мавджуда закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Мавджуда хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Мавджуде помогает старший сын Толиб.
texts.en:
Mavdjuda is 48 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. She has a secondary education. Mavdjuda sells perfumes and household products. Because her husband passed away, she has to raise her children by herself, which is, of course, very hard. Mavdjuda buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Mavdjuda wants to expand her merchandise assortment because good variety attracts more customers. Mavdjuda’s oldest son, Tolib, helps her with the business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand merchandise assortment

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 29, a motor-taxi driver, has one young child and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife, Chea Sophy, a garment factory worker. Their combined income of around $8 each day supports both their household and their parents.  Bun is asking for a loan of $1000 to repair his house as the roof leaks during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair leaking roof.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen S., 39, is a widowed fruit seller who lives with her three children. Living in Phnom Penh, she typically makes $7 every day and is aided by her two children who work in garment factories.

The Phnom Penh area has not seen favorable weather conditions for growing this past year. Along with increased inflation, it has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. Pen S. is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase more fruit, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila R. is from the city of Brgy. 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. Thirty-three years old and married with four school-aged children, Cerila owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Cerila is just starting this business.

In 2009, Cerila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more items for her store and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina D. has been a farmer for seventeen years. She is 37 years old and the mother of seven children. She dreams of sending all her children to school so that when they are older, they will have a better future for their families. 

Her harvest is what she uses to provide the family’s basic needs like food and clothing. She would like to ask a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm needs. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to improve their harvest. She also dreams to expand her business.

She is happy because she has a partner in running her business. CEVI helps her have a loan. It also provides training and insurance coverage to all its clients to make their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase farm materials like fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena B. is from the city of Brgy. 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Magdalena owns and operates a specialized business. She is into homemade food products like peanut butter and she's also into RTW (ready-to-wear clothes) sales. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Magdalena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more RTW clothes and ingredients for her peanut butter business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more RTW clothes and ingredients for her peanut butter business

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita O. is from the city of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old, single, and has one school-aged child. Merlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her child and as supplemental income for the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Алишер мужчина-28 лет. Женат имеет одного ребёнка.Жена домохозяйка, нянчит своего маленького ребёнка.Алишер занимается продажей парфюмерии и хозяйственным товаром на рынке "Панчшанбе"города Худжанда.Алишер как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги.Он хочет на полученный займ купить мыло, шампунь, зубную пасту и других ассортимент.Алишер закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Алишер очень признателен нашей организации хочет в дальнейшем развиваться.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Alisher is a 28 year old man. He is married and has one child. His wife is a housewife and babysits their small child. Alisher is in the retail of perfumes and household items on the market of Pancshabe of the town of Khujand. Alisher as the head of the household is working and earning money. He wants to use the loan to buy soap, shampoo, toothpaste and other items. Alisher buys her merchandise at the wholesale market of the town of Istaravshan. Alisher is very grateful to our organization and wants to expand in the future.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume and household items

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita F. manages a small rice field. She is a 37-year-old mother and has four children. Her husband, Rodrigo F. tills the field. They are busy as a bee making their farm productive to provide the family basic needs. Anita started farming fifteen years ago. Her farm is situated at their location. Aside form rice, she also manages a sari-sari (variety) store to supplement their income. Anita would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm needs. The loan will help her achieve a better yield on her farm. CEVI helps small business grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm needs

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn R. is from the city of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old and is married. Ailyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma D. is from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 55 years old, widowed, and has four children. Two of her children have already finished their studies in college, while the two youngest are presently studying.

Wilma owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling pop-rice and popcorn. Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of PHP8,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma P. is from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 37 years old. Vilma is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. 

Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of PHP13,000 which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene P. owns a small rice farm. Her main crop is rice. She has been tilling the farm for seven years to help support the needs of her family. She is 31 years old and has two children. Her husband, Hegino P. Jr., manages their farm. She never stops dreaming that someday she will be able to buy an additional farm lot of 1-hectare. She also wishes to have a better quality of life and good health for all her children.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm needs. She thinks that her loan from CEVI will help her improve her yield in the future.

CEVI helps small farmers sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farming needs

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo F. is from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. He is 51 years old. Rodrigo is married to Corazon, who is 49 years old. They have 2 adult-aged children who are both married. To make a living, Rodrigo owns and operates a service-based business. He is a simple tricycle driver in their village. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from offering transportation services in his village as well as his farming activities at home. 

Rodrigo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of PHP8,000  which will be used to repair his tricycle type vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Rodrigo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. is from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 35 years old. Norma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business venture in the transportation services sector operating a cart pulled by a horse, which is called a "kalesa" business. "Kalesa" is one of the oldest forms of transportation in the Philippines. It helps in providing transportation services to local community members.  
 
Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of PHP 5000, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. The loan was also a big help in providing daily allowances for her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.name: Nonelyn

texts.en:
Nonelyn R. is from the town of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Nonelyn is married to Theddy and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Nonelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nonelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nonelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nonelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase grocery items for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nonelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

loans.name: Gay

texts.en: Gay believes in the saying that “small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises”. She has been operating a variety store for already twelve years. Her business is located just in front of their house in Barangay San Isidro of Ilagan, Isabela. Gay is now 37 years old and is married to Reden R. who is an operator of a passenger tricycle in their village. They are blessed with three children who are all currently studying. Their eldest is Rhoder, 13 years old, with Reejay, 10 years old, and Jasmine, 6 years old. Gay is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders to be used as additional revolving capital in expanding her general store business. She also plans to retail tricycle spare parts in their village because she knows that there are lots of tricycle operators in their area. She hopes that the loan she is requesting will be provided by Kiva lenders because she believes Kiva will help her develop her business through their financial support which will be of great benefit to her children someday. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora D. has been tilling the rice field for 37 years. She is 60 years old this year. She is already a widow and what is left to her is her six children, who are also having their own families. She has a 1 hectare rice farm. Her harvest is what she uses to support her own needs as well as those of her children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farming needs. She hopes that with her loan that she availed herself of from CEVI she will be able to improve her rice farm business.

Through CEVI, she has saved money for the rains. Aside from buying her own needs, she was able to provide the needs of her children also. CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm needs

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida Z. is from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 42 years old. Nida is married to a farmer in their village and has 7 children. The eldest has already graduated college while the other six children are currently studying in college, high school and in elementary level. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale and also rice farming. 

Nida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be taken out by Nida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and she wants the children to finish their studies in order to have a better future.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

To make a living, Cerenia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn N. is 27 years old, married and has four school-age children.They are from the village of Mamanga Daku. To make a living, Jesselyn raises pigs to sell. Jesselyn is just starting this business.

In 2006, Jesselyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jesselyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Jesselyn is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 38 years old and married to Armando, a farmer. They have three children: one is a vocational graduate while two are still studying. Her family lives in the village of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Isabela. Her family is happy and has good bonding. 

Lucrecia believes that “time is gold”. She makes use of her time wisely for her business to become productive. She always thinks about the sake of her children. She would like to request a loan of PHP 30,000 as additional capital for her general store business. She hopes to improve her business and somehow expand to other businesses so that she will able to make the loan productive and profitable to her family members.

loans.use: To use as business capital for her general store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda T. has been engaged in her rice farming business since 1979. She grows rice to be able to support the needs of her family. She is 59 years old and has eight children. She tills her 1.75-hectare (4.5-acre) farm to buy the needs of their home. She wishes, someday, to have a business expansion of her farm. Now, what she needs is additional capital to sustain her livelihood. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm needs. The loan will improve her harvest. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm needs

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S., 35, is a professional hairdresser who resides in Phnom Penh. She typically makes $8 of profit every day. However she must also support an older father and mother at home. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. To make more money, she is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase hairdressing materials.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes B. is from the town of Launion, San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, married, and has ten adult children. Agnes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Agnes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery items for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites quoted that “behind sacrifices awaits lots of prizes”. She believes that doing her best and sacrificing everything for her family will someday bear good fruit. She is a mother who is very supportive of her children. She is 38 years old and married to Bob who is a responsible husband. They have two children who are now in the elementary level. 
	
Marites operates a vending business, selling different kinds of cooked snacks such as banana cue (fried banana coated with sugar), peanuts and so on, in their village. She felt the need to work that led her to start her small business. She is now asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 6,000. She said that she will use the loan wisely for her business to become profitable for her family.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla considers her family as a treasure that she needs to keep and take care of. She is engaged in the hog raising business, for she believes that in this way she can support the needs of her family especially in sending her children to school.

She is 36 years old and has three children. Her husband is working as a farmer and they are helping one another to meet the needs of their family. She is not able to send two of her children to high school due to lack of financial resources. Fortunately, she learned about Kiva lenders who can provide her with business capital. At the moment she is asking if she can borrow PHP 9,000 for her hog-raising business. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she can maintain it for their welfare.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita and her husband Lope live in Barangay Sta. Rosa Gamu, Isabela. She is 47 years old and she manages a rice vending business while her husband is working as a carpenter. They are blessed with seven children, and three of them are still studying.

Perlita is working hard to provide the needs of her children especially those who are still studying. She wants to fulfill the dream of her daughter Marilyn, who really wants to finish her college education, by patiently maintaining her rice vending business. She is requesting to borrow a loan amounting to PHP6,000 as additional capital in her small enterprise.

She started her business three years ago and she is able to earn a net income of PHP 125.00 a day. She will utilize the loan to make her business grow and she believes that through this, they can have a progressive way of living.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe J. is from the village of Silanga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Maria Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Fe owns and operates a business venture in the construction sector, providing carpentry services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members. Maria Fe has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. This will be the first loan taken out by Maria Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
“It is better to give than to receive,” said Anabelle, who manages a general store. Her family lives in the rural area of Barangay Lamo Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She married Gary after she graduated from college. They planned to have only one child because life is too difficult nowadays; they wanted to surely give him/her better future by providing education.

Anabelle has been managing her store for many years. Aside from her store, she is also selling fish for bigger income. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional working capital to further develop her store into a progressive one.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut N., 37, has been involved in a business selling Khmer noodles (a very common Cambodian food) in the nearby local markets in Battambong province since 2000 with an income of US$ 6. She lives with her husband and her two children. Her husband makes a living by operating a motor taxi with an income of US$ 4 per day.

Together N. and her husband plan to take a loan of US$ 800 to create another business selling groceries at her house. (N. is pictured in the photo with her noodle business.)

loans.use: buying more groceries for her store

loans.name: Adjimo

texts.fr: Adjimo W. est une femme de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle vend divers articles sous un hangar à Lomé. Adjimo souhaite avec ce crédit louer un magasin et y tenir le commerce d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Adjimo W. is 32-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two. She sells various goods in a covered stall in Lomé. She wishes to use this loan to lease a shop and to run a general store in it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease a store and to stock it

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia runs a vegetable vending business in their village in Lamo Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She hopes to make her business grow but she needs additional capital to fulfill her plans. For this, she is borrowing the loan amount of PHP 5,000 as business capital.

She is 32 years old and married to Delmar. They have two children, and they want them to finish their college education. She and her husband are helping one another to earn a living for their family. Her husband manages their farm lot and sometimes assists her in vending. Sometimes they experience financial difficulties, especially since they have a low income. This is one main reason why she really wants her business become progressive and sustainable. She hopes that Kiva lenders will help them earn their livelihood.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a dealer in beauty products in their village. Due to lack in financial capital to sustain her business, she was motivated to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. This amount will be of great help in improving her business, since she wants her family have a better way of living.

Cynthia is married to Rogelio and blessed with two children and they are now in college. They are living in the village of Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. Cynthia is aiming to strengthen her direct-selling business because it does not only help her family financially but it also develops her self-confidence and she gains new friends.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Hak T., 29, is married and lives with her husband and three young children in Phnom Penh. She is a professional tailor, making about US$ 2 each day. Her husband is a mechanic who makes around US$ 7 each day.

Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. In light of the struggling economy, she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to purchase cloth to expand her business. She sees an opportunity to increase her income and believes their standard of living will improve.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for her business

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success” is the motivational quotation in life of Jay B. in the village of Lamo Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. “Jing” as she is called in their village is married to Elisio B. and they have two children. They want to provide them with a good education and for them to have a successful future.

Jay manages a general store in their village. The business is very helpful in sustaining their family, paying for important necessities especially in sending their children to school. Jay is hoping to take out a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional business capital. She started her business with little capital and with hard work, she has been able to maintain her small enterprise and make it grow. Jay is positive that with the help of the lenders, her business will become progressive.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen C., 27, typically provides transportation services with his motorbike at local markets in Battambong Province with an income of US$ 3 per day. He lives with his wife and his only child who does not attend school yet. His wife is a good cook and earns an income of US$ 3 per day.

To make a better living standard, he and his wife want to take a loan of US$ 1000 to buy bamboo and wood to build a grocery store in front of their house to generate more income for the family's future use.

loans.use: buying bamboo and wood to buid a grocery store

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth still looks like a teenager at her age of 30 years. This is in relation to her direct selling business in which she sells different beauty products and personal things for men and women in their village at San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela.

Janeth is married to Ramon, a government employee, and they have a daughter who is already 8 years old attending the third grade in the elementary. Janeth is so thankful for having a responsible husband and a loving daughter. They have a good relationship in the family. She hopes and prays that the good relationship they have for each other will remain as time goes by.

Janeth has been running her direct-selling business for almost three years. She uses the different company brochures of Avon, Boardwalk, Natasha, Sara Lee and MSE to encourage customers to place their orders which she will then purchase in the company branch outlet in the market.

Because she wants her business to grow further, Janet decided to request additional business capital of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders. She strongly believes that having enough capital will lead to a better business output if managed wisely. Furthermore, Janeth is saving not only for her daughter’s education but also for their house repairs somehow.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Peace's Group

texts.en:
N. Peace is a 30-year-old hardworking and married lady with four children aged 14 – 4 years, the eldest being in senior 4 and the youngest in the nursery section.

Peace has had a bar and hotel as her business for a long time in Kabogore Trading Centre. Her success is attributed to her ability to have enough foodstuffs to prepare in addition to the sauce as well as having enough drinks for her bar. Peace needs a new loan to be able to restock her bar with more beer, wine and soft drinks. She is the leader of Kabogore Twimukye group in Ibanda.

loans.use: To restock her restaurant and bar with more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is 34 years old and married with two children. She sells paint in her shop and is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more paint to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more paint to sell

loans.name: Eva Nalukwago Group

texts.en:
Eva is a leader of four members of a group. She is 35 years old and married with four children aged between 3 and 10. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she lives with three people. She takes care of two additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Eva runs her business in Kisasi and so she incurs transportation costs to and from shopping. She sells to an average of forty people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for her business and feeding the family. Besides this retail shop she sells charcoal. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Eva has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her 18th loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her restaurant. Eva is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her restaurant

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
“Behind the clouds, the sun is still shining,” shared Lydia B. when asked about her view of life. Lydia, 50 years old and blessed with four children, is a business-minded woman residing in the village of San Isidro Ilagan, Isabela, where she is married to Rogelio, a farmer. Two of their children are already married and the other two are still single, the youngest studying in college. Through Lydia’s vending snacks in their village and her husband patiently maintaining their farm, they have been able to provide their four children with a college education. At present, her two married children are working for their own families while her third child is assisting them with some of their finances at home and the education of their youngest one.

Aside from selling snacks, Lydia also sometimes sells vegetables harvested from their farm. She is very patient and diligent in her business because she wants her family to have a good future and is hoping to avail a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase more products to sell. She still wants her youngest child to finish her college degree to be able to attain her dreams just like her elder brother and sisters. With the help of the Almighty, she knows that He will guide them in reaching each of their goals in life. She also prays for the good health of the family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Koff

texts.fr: Koffi K. est un jeune homme de 29 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé. Il exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans. Koffi souhaite avec ce crédit acheter sa propre moto pour mieux épargner afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi K. is a young man, 29 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is a motorbike taxi driver in Womé. He has been in this business for four years. He wishes to use this loan to buy his own motorbike in order to save more money, so as to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorbike

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
“Patience and perseverance overcome mountains,” says Marilou. No matter how difficult life is, when you strive to overcome, by inches, of the test of times, you will become successful, she added. Marilou is already 43 years old and is married to Benjamin G., 49 years old. The couple is blessed with five children who are all studying at the moment. 

Marilou struggles a lot in order to help her husband to provide for the needs of their children. She further said that through her sacrifices and patience she is able to survive life’s difficulties. Presently, Marilou is engaged in a vending business. She sells street foods and refreshments everyday in their village. She wants her business to grow and to increase her daily income, so she is requesting to borrow PHP 6,000 to be used as additional business capital. This will help her family a lot because she knows that in this business she will gain more income. She also aims to become successful in their life someday and she hopes that by providing her with this loan, she can shift up from their poor ways of living.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mulija

texts.en: Mulija Hajrić was born in 1976. She is now divorced and lives in the town of Visoko with her six year old daughter. Mulija is not employed and lives on a very low income. She produces vegetables for her own use and earns some money from time to time. She also raises chickens and gets eggs, for her own use. Mulija decided to take her first loan in WWI (Žene za Žene International) in the amount of 1000 KM. She will use this loan to purchase chickens to fatten for poultry food. Mulija`s daughter will start her first school classes this autumn. Mulija wants to use the income from the sale of chicken meat to provide the needed supplies for her daughter to start with school.

loans.use: To purchase the chickens to fatten for poultry food.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo B. est un homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Kodzo désire avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto. Il compte sur cette chance pour changer les conditions de sa vie.
texts.en:
Kodzo B. is a 35-year-old man, married, and the father of two. He is a motorbike taxi driver in Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy a new motorbike. He is counting on this chance to change his living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
To have a safe and comfortable house to live in is one of the dreams of Mary C., in addition to sending all her children to school until college. Mary is 46 years old and married to Ricardo. They live in the village of San Isidro Ilagan, Isabela. They are blessed with four children, one of them is still studying. One of her children is working abroad, the other one is working in a Coca-Cola company. Their eldest child is already married. 

Mary is engage in a snack-vending business in their village. She cooks native snacks made out from glutinous rice. She is requesting to borrow loan amounting to PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders in order to support her vending business for sustainability. She also sells street foods during late afternoon. She aims to improve her business by having more or sufficient products for her vending business. She hopes that her loan will be provided for the growth of her business because it will help her reach out for her dreams in life.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Yawo K. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. il arrive à nourrir difficilement sa famille étant donné que sa moto est vieille et lui cause régulièrement des dépenses pour la réparation. Avec ce crédit, Yawo souhaite acheter une nouvelle moto afin de mieux exercer son métier et gagner plus d’argent. Cette activité est devenue la principale activité source  de revenus de la jeunesse.
texts.en:
Yawo K. is 35 years old, married, and the father of three. He manages to feed his family with difficulty, given that his motorbike is old and regularly costs him to repair it. With this loan, he wishes to buy a new motorbike in order to work at his trade and to earn more money. This trade has become the principal business and source of revenue for young people.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Florence Nakyeyune Group

texts.en: Florence is the leader of this group of 5 members.  She is 45 years old, married, with three children aged between 18 and 20 years. All of her children go to school. She resides in a five-roomed house, that she owns, where she is staying with five people. Florence takes care of two additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Florence sells bananas in Kalerwe market and doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to all categories of people, an average of 30 customers a day. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business, feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last nine years. Florence has been with MCDT for over seven years and is managing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy ½ lorry of bananas and cutlery. Florence is aspiring to see her business grow bigger to be able to off-load a full lorry of bananas.

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith H. is managing a small rice field. She has workers in her farm because her husband is currently ill. She is 60 years old and has two children. She dreams to grow her business, even more to have a better quality of life for her family. Aside from rice, she also manages a small piggery. She has been doing multiple businesses to supplement the income of the family.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She thinks that, by her loan, she will be able to increase the profit of her farm.

Through CEVI, the dream of expanding her business is within reach. CEVI provides their clients, not just credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm needs.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is only 22 years old. She is involved in a vending business in their rural village of San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Jay-ar C. who is presently working as a helper to support their daily needs. The couple has a child named Mikyla Jane who is now three years old. 

Michelle sells vegetables in their place and is proposing to Kiva lenders to borrow PHP 6,000 in order to make her business grow and be more beneficial for her family, especially for her child who soon will enter school. She purchases fresh vegetables in their public market then sells them in the village. Michelle also wants to venture into a direct-selling business if she will have enough capital, so that she will have another extra source of income aside from vending.

At present, her family is living in the house of her parents-in-law. This is one of the reasons why she keeps on working hard for them to have their own house someday.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima sells sarongs to her customers. She is 35 years old and is married with five children. Fatima hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more wrappers to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia believes that the fruit derived from her hard work is the sweetest of all. She, being a hardworking mother, feels great to see the success of her children in their own chosen careers. She is blessed with eight children: her eldest child, Sherwin, 28, is already contented in his handicraft business in Cebu; Sherly, 26, is now working abroad as a caregiver; Shari Davis, 22 years old, is a fourth-year college student taking up Industrial Technology; Sandy, 20, is also studying in college, taking an Education course; Sand Lover - 15, and Silver Valy - 14, are both studying in high school; Silverio Jr. - 9 and Sidney May - 5 are both studying in the primary level. Through working diligently and patiently, Simplicia hopes that all her children will have attained a quality education someday. She is married to Silverio and he works as a furniture maker.
 
Simplicia and her husband are helping one another in their furniture making business. She displays her products in different places to attract more customers to buy their furniture. They have to work hard in order to support the education of their six children. Simplicia needs additional capital of at least PHP 10,000 to purchase wood that they need in making furniture. She is also planning to start a poultry business for additional source of income.

Simplicia hopes that they can provide for all their children’s needs because it is their goal to give them an education. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support their business to improve it so that it becomes progressive. All their efforts and sacrifices are dedicated to their children.

loans.use: To purchase wood that they need in making furniture

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Гавхар -женщина 37 лет. Замужем имеет 3-х детей.Её муж уехал в Российскую федерацию, чтобы там зарабатывать деньги, как и многие рабочие мигранты, которые не могут найти здесь нормальную работу.Гавхар занимается продажей продуктовых товаров, таких как чай, сок, газированная вода и другие.
Её торговая точка расположена на центральном рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда и поэтому торговля у нее идёт хорошо. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть ещё одну точку продажи.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Gavhar is a 37 year old woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to earn money as many other migrant workers who cannot find a normal job here. Gavhar sells food products such as tea, juice and soda. Her vendor spot is located on the central market of Pancshabe of the town of Khujand and her sales are very good. She wants to expand her business and open one more vendor location.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Mechie

texts.en:
Mechie C. is a 49-year-old widow with two children. She’s been engaged in the farming business for twenty years now. Her income goes to the maintenance of their house, some personal needs and for her children’s education. She has always dreamed to see her children finish their schooling and acquire a degree. Thus, she strives hard to expand her business to realize this dream.

Mechie now thinks of acquiring a piece of land, probably less than a hectare (2.5 acres). While that remains a long-term plan for her, she presently looks forward to buying fertilizers and other farming necessities to sustain her present business status.

With this, Mechie is applying for a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) worth Php 10,000 as additional capital. She chooses CEVI because they provide not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: Jinky B. is from the town of Damayuhan, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, married, and has two infant children. Jinky owns and operates a business selling different varieties of vegetables, selling through peddling in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Jinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell, like cabbages, potatoes, eggplants, string beans, squash and others. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell like, cabbages, potatoes, eggplants, and others

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose T. is the leader of the Kakunama II Twetungure group in Ibanda. She is a friendly, determined and hardworking lady. Rose is married with six children in secondary and primary school. She also cares for four orphans.

Rose has had a retail shop as her business for eight years and although she tries so hard to make it stand, she faces the challenge of bad debtors that take goods and then fail or take a very long to pay back. She is able to make 140,000 UGX in profits per month due to the good products and good customer care that keeps attracting more and more customers. Rose has a dream of expanding her business further so that she can have a very happy family in the future. She needs another loan to be able to restock her retail shop with more goods like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, bread and so on.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more products

loans.name: Rose Nankya Group

texts.en: Rose is the leader of a group of 4 members. She is 36 years old, married, and has two children, aged 13 and 16. Both her children go to school. She resides in a rented three-roomed house, where she is staying with five people. Rose doesn’t have to take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, in the outskirts of Kampala. Rose sells charcoal at Ndeeba market, in one of Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of 20 people a day, all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get the charcoal from villages. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last seven years. Rose has been with MCDT for over six years and now requesting her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal.  Rose is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and offloading a full lorry of charcoal.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Sena

texts.fr: Sena A. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de camion. Sena exerce cette activité depuis 7 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit réparer le moteur de son camion pour relancer son activité. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sena A. is a young man, 37 years old, married, and the father of two. He is a truck driver and has been in this business for seven years. He wishes to use this loan to repair the motor of his truck in order start up his business again. He is counting on this opportunity to do better in providing for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the motor in his truck

loans.name: Guendelyn

texts.en:
37-year-old Guendelyn C. of Banga, South Cotabato started her farming business 10 years ago. In addition, she’s still able to manage her hog-raising project. Her determination to support her husband in raising their two children pushes her to strive well in life. Presently, the business is self-financed by Guendelyn. As the business is growing, so are the expenses.

She is currently in need of additional capital to purchase other farming necessities. Thus, she applies for a loan in the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) amounting to PHO 10,000.00. She was greatly encouraged by CEVI’s mission to help small business grow. With this great favor she enjoys at CEVI, she is optimistic that a better future awaits for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a mother, full of hopes and dreams. She is married to Leonardo and they have six children: Jasmin - 26, Leorio - 23, Jun Leo - 21, Jordan Rey - 18, Nieves Leo - 16, and Gabriel - 5. Her two eldest children are newly graduated from college and the other four are still studying. She is proud of her children, for they really give attention in their studies. They live in the village of San Isidro Ilagan, Isabela. 

Susan wants to help her husband in providing for the needs of their children by venturing into RTW (ready to wear clothes) and blanket vending. She purchases her products in Baguio City and then sells in their village at a higher price in order to generate income. 

She is asking to borrow a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more products to later sell in their village. Susan is also engaged in selling furniture, as her part-time business. She uses canvassed prices from different furniture business establishments and will contract buyers later on to have extra income. Susan and her husband promise to give their best to be able to give their children the education they require for their future. Susan never gives up, no matter how hard life is. Education is the best thing she knows to give to their children. She is very thankful to God, who is always there to guide her family.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Charmaine

texts.en:
39-year-old Charmine M. is married to a farmer, Leonardo M. Jr. They are blessed with two children and are presently residing at Banga, South Cotabato. After her previous work as a housekeeper, Charmaine, together with her husband, decided to start a small farming business. They did not find this venture too difficult since they have been engaged with farming for almost 9 years now. The couple uses their income to finance their daily needs and the children’s schooling.

In order to expand their business, Charmaine is applying for a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) amounting to PHP 10,000. Because of CEVI’s strong drive to help small entrepreneurs grow their businesses, Charmaine is very confident that she’ll get to expand their livelihood and to continue supporting their children until they get their degrees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 56 years old. She manages a furniture making business in the village of San Isidro Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Rogelio, her partner in making furniture.
