loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Juvénal

texts.en:
Juvénal N. is 30 years old and the married father of four children, aged 3, 5, 7, and 9. He and his wife are in the agriculture business and they live in Byumba, Rwanda. Juvénal is pictured here with a small mill that processes sorghum, a grain product in Rwanda. 

Together, they earn monthly profits of 260,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) to support their family. Juvénal has requested his first loan of 300,000 FRW with Vision Finance Company, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase sorghum to process and sell.

loans.use: To purchase sorghum to process and sell

loans.name: Tsagaandolgor

texts.en:
Tsagaandolgor S., 58, lives with her husband Behbat in Uvurhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. All her children are living apart with their own families. In 1992 Tsagaandolgor started running a vegetable garden business, planting potatoes and carrots on 10,000 sq. meters. Since then she has expanded and is now gardening on 30,000 sq. meters of land. She also purchases a variety of fruits and vegetables transported by Behbat to retailers to resell at retail prices.

Their working capital is 2.5 million ($1 USD= 1450 MNT) and monthly income from the business is 3.1 million tugrugs, with net monthly profits of 350,000 tugrugs. S. is a very friendly and open person who is requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Azimchon

texts.ru: Азимчон – молодой человек 1983 года рождения. Холост. Занимается продажей кондитерских изделий на рынке «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Азимчон привозят товар оптовые кондитерские фирмы. Ему привозят товар 3 раза в месяц. Азимчон планирует расширить бизнес и закупить партию импортных конфет и печений. Поэтому он просит кредит для осуществления своих планов.
texts.en:
Azimchon is 26 years old, unmarried, and sells confectionary products at the "Panshabe" market in Khujand. He receives wholesale goods from confectionary companies three times a month. Azimchon plans to expand his business and begin purchasing imported chocolates and cookies. He is asking for a loan in order to realize these plans.

Translated from Russian by Pavle Milekic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of chocholates and other sweets for resale

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en:
Banzragch S. is a single father who has one daughter. In 1993, together with his wife he started a retail business buying and selling raw materials related to livestock. He also buys wool, fur, cashmere and the leather from local herders at wholesale prices and resell them at a retail prices.

His spouse got sick and died a half a year ago. Since then, his business income has decreased. Banzragch is trying his best to move on and keep running his business at the local market. Banzragch is a well respected person as he has a loyal, hard working and humble personality. With this loan he plans to buy wool, cashmere and animal leather.

loans.use: Buy wool, cashmere, fur, leader etc.

loans.name: Osei

texts.en: Osei is 36 years old.  He is married with four kids.  Three are in school.  He is a taxi driver and has been doing this for the past six years.  Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He picks up passengers from the local station and drives them to nearby towns for a fare of 50 pesewas (0.5 cedis) per head.  However, his business is in crisis because his car has broken down and he needs money for repairs.  He requests a loan to maintain his taxi car to resume his business to make income to support his family and get his kids back to school.  He belongs to a community group called Fervent Trust.  Members guarantee each others loans and apply peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: Maintain taxi car.

loans.name: Chemsa

texts.en: Chemsa U. runs a beauty salon in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  At 29 years old, Chemsa is married with three children (aged 2, 6, and 9).  In order to expand her business, which makes her 100,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) per month, she requests a loan from Vision Finance Company of 500,000 FRW.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Bayarsayhan

texts.en:
Bayarsayhan O., 35, is a married and the father of two. His family lives in "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on a plot of land he owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has run a plank sales business for the last several years. Bayarsayhan has a pick-up truck that transports planks from Arhangay province to Ulaanbaatar. He buys planks in Arhangay province at wholesale prices and sells them at retail prices.

Bayarsayhan's spouse Chingelmaa always encourages her husband however she can't physically help him as she stays home and takes care of their four years old son.

He requests a loan to buy planks to increase his business inventory. Bayarsayhan's dream is to open a car care center on his land.

loans.use: Purchase planks for his business.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: khady D. est parent beneficiaire a camberene specialisee dans la vente de tissus en provenance du mali.elle capitalise deux ans d'experience dans cette activite qui commence a se developper.elle emprunte cinquante mille frs pour l'ajouter a son fond personnel en vue de pouvoir accroitre ses benefices.
texts.en:
Khady D. is a client parent in Camberene specialized in selling cloth from Mali. She capitalizes on two years of experience in this business, which is starting to develop. She is borrowing 50,000 francs to add to her own capital with the aim of growing her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Ahrorkhoja

texts.en:
R. Ahrorkhoja is 25 years old. Ahrorkhoja has his own grocery store and sells different kinds of foodstuff like: macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, detergents and many others. He started this business seven years ago with the small inventory. He has become very successful. Today Ahrorkhoja is requesting a loan of $3000. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

-------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuff to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en: Battumur T., 36, is married and father of two sons. Both his sons are attending a local elementary school. His family lives in Arhangay, one of Mongolia’s central provinces. He has been running a retail business, for the last 9 years, selling wool, cashmere and leather. His spouse Ariunjargal, 33, helps him in his business. Since his business is running successfully, his working capital has increased from 300,000 tugrugs to 2,000,000 tugrugs ($1 USD=1450 MNT). With the profit, Battumur has bought a vehicle for his household needs. He also pays for his two sons tuition fees, as his sons are going to private schools. Battumur is an open and friendly person. He says, "I’ll be working hard to expand my business and to prepare for my children's future." With this loan, he will buy more unprocessed wool and cashmere and will resell the products at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wool, cashmere and leather.

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en:
V. Gulomjon is 25 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Gulomjon has been running the business already for 3 years. He is selling household appliances in his store. The business generates a significant income for the family allowing for improving their living conditions. Today Gulomjon requests 3000 Somoni, as a loan. Gulomjon is going to spend the loan for purchasing new goods for selling. He is very thankful for those lenders who support him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for selling.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah T. is thirty years old. She is married and has two children. One child is currently in school. Hannah is a trader and loves selling. She sells food products like cassava dough, corn dough and maize in the local market of Bawjiase where she lives. Banku, one of the popular Ghanaian dishes, is produced by milling fresh cassava and maize into cassava and corn dough. Selling for the past five years, she has lots of experience to win customers. 
Hannah is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with a quality education for their future careers. With this loan, she wants to purchase increased stock of cassava and maize to produce enough cassava and corn dough to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is a member of the borrowing group called ‘Maranatha Trust Group’. In this group members provide support to one another in handling repayment. She does not sell on days of her group meeting and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase cassave and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She is 38 years old and married, with 4 children. Felicia is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.ru: Мирзоев Сайфулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Сайфулло более 3 лет занимается пчеловодством, он производит мед и продает его на рынке. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Saifullo M. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 31 years old. He is married and has one child. Saifullo has been a beekeeper for more than three years, he produces honey and sells it on the market. The client is asking for a loan to increase his production volume.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase production volume

loans.name: Fadiaye

texts.fr: fadiaye S. habite a camberene et est parent beneficiaire.elle est commercante de chaussures de bijoux plaques or et divers autres articles pour femmes.elle a cinq ans d'experiences dans cette activite'et souhaite augmenter le nombre de clientele et conquerir d'autres marches.
texts.en:
Fadiaye S. lives in Camberene and is a client parent. She is a merchant of shoes, gold-plated jewelry, and various other items for women. She has five years of experience in this business and wishes to increase her number of customers and to conquer other markets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Z. Dilbar is 42 years old. She is married and has 3 children. The elder daughter is already married and the two younger children are still living with the parents. The husband of Dilbar is not earning much money. In order to help her husband, and to support her family, Dilbar has been running her business already for 2 years. She is selling household appliances with the help of her daughter (pictured). All the equipment is imported from Uzbekistan and other countries. The business generates a significant income for the family, allowing improvement of their living conditions. Today, Dilbar requests 3000 Somoni. She is going to purchase new household appliances for expanding the variety of goods that she has for sale. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new appliances for selling.

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Зиеева Мавчуда проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 51 год. Разведена, имеет 3 детей. Мавчуда более 4 лет занимается торговлей, она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует продуктами питания. Клиентка просит кредит, для того чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Mavchuda Z. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 51 years old. She is divorced and has three children. Mavchuda is in a retail business for more than four years and has a vendor spot on the market where she sells food products. The client is asking for a loan to increase her sales and circulation of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation of goods

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith M. is a 38-year-old widow with four children and two other child dependents. For three years, she has run a business selling spare parts in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) to help her expand this business. This is Judith's first loan with Vision Finance Company.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Nkechi sells Kunu (A locally made drink from guinea corn). Kunu is a popular drink in Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more ingredients to make more kunu to sell. She is 31 years old and married, with a child. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like millet, joro and guinea corn to make more kunu to sell.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Акбарова Дилором- женщина 1961-го года рождения, разведённая сама воспитывает двоих детей.  Имеет среднее образование. Работает воспитателем в детском саду.Чтобы как-то пополнить свой семейный бюджет она решила   заняться  продажей метражных тканей и женской обуви на центральном  рынке  Джаббор-Расуловского района.Так как у нее  нет мужа , она растит 2-х детей в одиночку и конечно же ей очень трудно. Дилором  закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан.  Она хотела  бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому что, хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Dilorom A. is a woman born in 1961, divorced and is raising her children by herself. She has secondary education. She works as a mentor in a kindergarten. To increase her family budget just a little bit she has decided to start selling fabrics and women's shoes on the central market of Jabbor-Rasulov region. As she does not have a husband and is raising two children alone it is very difficult for her. Dilorom buys the merchandise from the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan. She wants to increase the assortment of her merchandise because a good variety attracts more customers. For this she has decided to take out a loan to increase the assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one roll of summer fabric and a batch of summer shoes

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 50 years old. She is a widow and has three children. She trades in assorted washing soaps and kerosene in the local market of Kasoa, a town in the Central Region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She requests for a loan to enable her to buy cartons of soap and barrels of kerosene to expand her business and to scale up sales. She hopes to increase her savings enough to support her last child’s education. She belongs to the community group called Abigail Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of soap and barrels of kerosene.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi B. est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé. Âgé de 36 ans, koffi est marié et père d’un enfant. il exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans. Kodzo désire avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto et bailler le premier à une tiers personne contre des versements des mensualités. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et par conséquent améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi B. is a motorbike taxi driver in Womé. He is 36 years old, married, and the father of one child. He has been in this business for four years. He would like to use this loan to buy a new motorbike and to rent out the old one to a third person for monthly deposits. This will enable him to augment his revenues and consequently to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Домуллоева Махсуда - женщина 44-х лет, замужем, имеет 4-х детей.Чтобы прокормить свою семью она вместе со своим мужем  занимается откормом и купля-продажей скота.Живут они в селе где нет работы. Основной источник дохода это выращивание сельской хозяйственной  культуры и  откорм скота. Ее старший сын присылает ей немного денег, но теперь из-за кризиса он последние 2 месяца не присылал денег.  
Она продала быка и  планировала купить дойную корову. Но корова стоит дороже и для этого она обратилась за кредитом в Микроинвест. Узнала об условиях кредита. После получения кредита купила корову. Теперь у нее есть несколько дойных коров.  Махсуда и её муж Домуллоев Абдумажит благодарны КИВА за поддержку их бизнеса.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mahsuda D. is a 44 year old woman, married and has four children. To be able to feed her family she together with her husband are feeding and selling cattle. They live in the village where there's no work. Their main source of income is raising of cattle and growing of agricultural produce. Her oldest son sends her some money, but now because of the financial crisis he has not sent money for the last two months. She sold a bull and planned to buy a milk cow. But the cow costs more and for this she has come to MicroInvest for a loan. She learned about the loan terms. After receiving the loan she has bought a cow. Right now she has several milk cows. Mahsuda and her husband Abdumajit Domulloev are thankful to Kiva for supporting their business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine N. lives in Kigali, Rwanda and has an egg business, raising chickens and selling the eggs. At 31 years old, Clementine is a widow, but has two children and two other dependents, all in their teens and twenties. For two years she has worked at her business from 5am till 8pm, earning 150,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) in monthly profits. To help her expand her business, Clementine has requested a 500,000 FRW loan from Vision Finance Company.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Аликулова Парвина проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 22 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Парвина вместе с мужем занимается торговлей. Она торгует видеодисками, этим видом бизнеса занимается более 13 лет. Клиентка просит кредит, увеличить товараоборот, т.е. закуп новых видеодисков.
texts.en:
Parvina A. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 22 years old, married and has 2 children. Parvina and her husband are involved in sales. She sells video disks and has been involved in this business for over 13 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover, i.e. purchase of new video disks.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, 44 years old, is divorced and has three children who are currently in school. She trades in clothes: kente, lace, jewelery, women slippers and dressing bags. She normally buys her supplies on credit and pays back when the goods are sold. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased working capital. She wants to use the loan to purchase clothes in bulk, slippers and dressing bags to enable her to reduce her cost to raise good income. She hopes to use part of her profit to expand her shop and also support her household, especially her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, slippers and dressing bags in bulk.

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She is 35 years old and married with three children. Folashade is a LAPO client. She is hoping for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia N. is 38 years old and married with two children. She has operated a clothing business for more than 20 years. She is using the loan to purchase more clothing for her shop to meet customer demand. She is a hardworking lady whose future plan is to improve her business and buy more clothing products to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her shop to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells baby clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, and feeding bottles as well as ladies skirts and blouses in her community. She is 51 years old and married with two children who are currently in school. She will use this loan to increase her stock of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials so she can increase her income to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of baby supplies

loans.name: Binbola

texts.en: Binbola sells drinks, juice and sachet water in her shop. She has three children and she is 32 years old. Binbola hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more drinks, sachet water and juice to sell. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a trader who sells assorted jewelry. She hawks from one community to the next. She is 28 years old and married with two children. Gladys has insufficient working capital to run her business. With this loan, she plans to inject more working capital into the business to scale it up. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality jewelry in large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She will use part of her profit to finance her kids' education. She is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To purchase assorted jewelry

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard B. owns a garage in Ibanda town, Bufunda Street. He works together with his brother and they train motorcycle mechanics. Before operating a garage, he was working in the tourism industry. He saved his money and started his own garage, "Mapema". He has been in the business for seven years so far and he has good customer care which has enabled him get many customers. This loan is to purchase more motorcycle spare parts for his garage. 
Richard is 39 years old and has been blessed with two children, ages 10 and 5 years old, both in school.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for a garage

loans.name: Tope

texts.en:
Tope sells ice fish to her customers in the market. She is 30 years old and married with two children. They live in Lagos State, Nigeria. Tope is very happy with her business. She does not sell on credit but her customers pay in cash when they purchase her ice fish. Tope hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more ice fish to sell. 
Tope is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Kate is a very skillful and talented hairdresser. She does all kinds of hair styles including plaiting, perming and fixing of weavons etc. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore, she wants to use this loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. to provide her customers with quality service. She believes in her ability to increase her income with this loan.
Kate is 45 years old and married with no children.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas K. is a single 23-year-old with one dependent. He makes a living running a hardware shop/general store which he has had for four years in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. This is his first loan with Vision Finance Company. With monthly earnings currently at 279,000 Rwandan francs (RWF), he would really like to expand his business. Thomas is hoping that the profits he makes with this 500,000 RWF loan will allow him to better feed himself and his dependent and that he can start to accumulate some savings.

loans.use: To expand a hardware shop/general store

loans.name: Oluwabumi

texts.en: Oluwabumi is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She has been a fashion designer since 2001. She is single without a child and she is 31 years old. Oluwabumi hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She is indeed grateful.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Clementina Joaquim

texts.pt:
Clementina Joaquim X. de 35 anos de idade, natural de boane, mãe de 2 filhos, vive em boane desde que nasceu. Vive com seu marido a mais de 10 anos com mais um sobrinho na casa dos pais. frenquenta 10 classe na Escola Secundaria de Boane. 

Trabalha como secretaria da Direção distrital de Educação de Boane, local de residência, e aufere um salário mensal de 2.100,00MT. Beneficiou se de uma formação especifica sobre a tarefa que exerce a mais de 5 anos.

Este é o seu quinto empréstimo e no valor de 20.000,00MT com os quais pretende dar continuidade na construção da casa de material convencional que vem fazendo desde os primeiros empréstimos. (6.500,00MT; 10.000,00MT; 11.000,00MT e 11.000,00MT).
  
Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de informações obtidas na sua instituição logo no dia da inauguração da sucursal de boane.

Sonha ter uma casa própria concluída para acomodar a sua família em melhores condiçoes e solicitar outros empréstimos para iniciar com pequenos negócios.
texts.en:
Clementina Joaquim X. is 35 years old. She is from Boane and has lived there since she was born. She has two children and lives with them and her husband of more than 10 years, as well as a nephew, in her parents' house. She attended school through the 10th grade at the Escola Secundaria de Boane. She works as a secretary in Boane's district education office and earns a monthly salary of 2100 MT. She received special training in her job responsibilities, and has held the position for more than five years. This is her fifth loan, in the amount of 20,000 MT, and she intends to use it to continue construction on her house, which she began building using the first loans (6500 MT; 10,000 MT; 11,000 MT e 11,000 MT). She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through information provided by her agency after the opening of the Boane branch. She dreams of having a house of her own so her family can enjoy a better quality of life, and of requesting additional loans so she can start other small business.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is twenty-nine years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She works very hard to provide a brighter future for her children. She is a trader who sells rice at the local market in her community. She buys her rice from wholesalers in Accra and resells them to her customers at profit. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice for keep and sell them over time to avoid price hikes from the current food crisis in the country. She belongs to the community group called Joyful Family Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice.

loans.name: Leonor Elija

texts.pt:
Leonor Elija C. nasceu em Gaza há 40 anos, viúva e mãe de 3 filhos maiores de idade e todos vivendo fora de boane. Sustenta três netos com idades compreendidas entre 8 e 12 anos que vivem com ela na mesma casa. Não concluiu a primeira classe, porque muito cedo contraiu problemas de vista. Chamou de doença espiritual! E, muito cedo foi à formação de cinco anos como curandeira.
 
Saiu de gaza na altura da guerra civil sozinha porque os filhos já se encontravam no Maputo, viveu com eles na mesma casa, e mais tarde arranjou um terreno e construiu a sua própria casa em Boane.

Leonor é negociante há três anos e dona do negocio onde trabalha cerca de 7 a 12 horas por dia. Não tem empregado e pessoalmente dedica se a venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, principalmente o amendoim que compra a 1.750,00MT o saco de 50 kg e vende a 50,00MT o kilo.
Consegue um rendimento diário de 700,00MT que os aplica nas despesas correntes e poupa algum dinheiro num banco comercial, onde tem a conta.

Leonor já levantou cinco empréstimos com a Hluvuku-Adsema todos para comercio e com este sexto de 15.00,00MT é para aumentar o volume da mercadoria assim como responder a demanda dos produtos.

Ouviu falar da hluvuku através das amigas. Os primeiros empréstimos foram de  2.500,00MT; 5.000,00MT; 8.000,00MT; 15.000,00, e 10.000,00MT.
No futuro, Leonor, pretende mobiliar a sua casa e para tal conta com mais empréstimos logo que terminar de pagar.
texts.en:
Leonor Elija C. was born in Gaza 40 years ago. She is a widow and the mother of three children who are all now adults and have moved away from Boane. She supports three grandchildren between the ages of 8 and 12, who live with her in her house. She didn't finish first grade because she had problems with her vision from a young age. It was said to be a spiritual malady. As a young girl she trained for five years as a traditional healer. She left Gaza during the civil war all by herself because her children were already living in Maputo. She lived in their house with them, and later acquired some land and built her own house in Boane. Leonor has been a businesswoman for three years and owns a business where she works 7 to 12 hours a day. She doesn't have any employees, and works on her own to sell staple goods, mainly peanuts, which she buys in 50-kg bags for 1750 meticals and sells for 50 meticals a kilo. She earns about 700 meticals a day, which she uses to cover living expenses, and then saves some money in a commercial bank, where she has an account. Leonor has already received five loans from Hluvuku-Adsema, all for her business. She will use this sixth loan of 15,000 meticals to increase her stock so she can respond to demand for goods. She heard about Hluvuku through friends. Her previous loans were in the amounts of 2500, 5000, 8000, 15,000, and 10,000 meticals. In the future, Leonor wants to furnish her house, and will request additional loans for that purpose once this one has been paid off.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Mr. T. Wilson is a carpenter. He is 45 years old and blessed with six children who are all in school. He owns a carpentry workshop in Ibanda. His experience in carpentry enables him to produce quality work attracting many customers. He is using the loan to purchase more wood to make furniture for his customers. He aspires to expand his carpentry workshop in the same location and attract even more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make furniture for his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing seeds and materials needed for planting process.

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.pt:
Daniel Ezequiel N. de 34 anos de idade, nasceu na provincia de Sofala, cidade da Beira (centro dos pais a 1.200km de Maputo), casado e pai de dois filhos menores de idade escolar.
Concluiu a formação media de docência e encontra se a trabalhar neste distrito a mais de oito anos. Sustenta seus pais que ficaram na província de origem, enviando lhes dinheiro. Tem um salário mensal no valor de 5.100,00MT.

Chegou a boane a procura de emprego na cidade de maputo e já vive em casa própria com sua esposa.

Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo no valor de 15.00,00MT que pretende comprar material de construção. Os primeiros créditos foram de 10.000,00MT; e 7.000,00MT, respectivamente. Teve informações sobre a existência da hluvukua traves de amigos e nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos.

Propõe se a pagar em harmonia com o plano de prestações para no futuro mais breve concluir a sua casa e construir um centro de negócios.
texts.en:
Daniel Ezequiel N. is 34 years old and was born in the province of Sofala, in Beira, a city in the middle of the country,1200 km from Maputo. He is married and has two young children of school age. He is trained as a teacher and has been working in the district for more than eight years. He supports his parents, who still live in their home province, by sending them money. He earns a monthly salary of 5100 MT. He arrived in Boane looking for work in Maputo, and now lives in his own home with his wife. This is his third loan, in the amount of 15,000 MT, which he will use to purchase construction materials. His first loans were 10,000 MT and 7000 MT respectively. He learned about Hluvuku through friends and has never had loans through other banks. He intends to pay off his loan in accordance with the loan schedule, and in the near future to be able to finish his house and build a commercial center.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
T. Christine is a teacher by profession and a hardworking business lady, married with two children of whom one is in school and another one working.

She has a retail shop selling basics. She is using the loan to purchase more retail items like sugar, soap, salt, wheat flour, rice, match boxes, etc. to expand on her retail in order to meet the wants of her customers. Her future plan is to work very hard to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items like sugar, soap, salt, wheat flour, rice, match boxes, etc. to meet the wants of her customers.

loans.name: Felix Vasco

texts.pt:
Felix Vasco A. de 34 anos de idade, nasceu na província de Manica, cidade de Chimoio (centro dos pais a 1.240km de Maputo), casado e pai de dois filhos menores de sete anos de idade. o primeiro filho estuda na escola primaria de boane.

Concluiu a formação media de docência e encontra se a trabalhar neste distrito a mais de oito nove. Sustenta seus pais que ficaram na província de origem, enviando lhes dinheiro. Tem um salário mensal no valor de 7.346,00MT e continuar com a sua formação no nível superior.

Chegou a boane a procura de melhores condições de vida e vive na casa própria com sua esposa e com mais um irmão sob sua responsabilidade.

Teve informações sobre a existência da hluvukua traves de amigos e nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 15.00,00MT e pretende comprar material de construção. O primeiro crédito foi de 11.500,00Mt. 

Propõe se a pagar em harmonia com o plano de prestações para terminar cedo a sua casa que esta cosntruindo em fases, para depois mobiliar.
texts.en:
Felix Vasco A. is 34 years old and was born in the province of Manica, in Chimoio, a city in the middle of the country,1240 km from Maputo. He is married and has two seven-year-old children. His eldest son studies in Boane's elementary school. He is trained as a teacher and has been working in the district for more than nine years. He supports his parents, who still live in their home province, by sending them money. He earns a monthly salary of 7346 MT and is continuing his studies. He arrived in Boane looking for a better quality of life. He lives with his wife in their own home, and also support a number of siblings. work in Maputo, and now lives in his own home with his wife. He learned about Hluvuku through friends and has never had loans through other banks. This is his second loan, in the amount of 15,000 MT, which he will use to purchase construction materials. His first loan was for 11,500 MT. He intends to pay off his loan in accordance with the loan schedule, in order to be able to finish the house he's been building in stages, and then furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Jubrim

texts.en: Jubrim sells weavon, hair extensions and jewellery in her house. Jubrim is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more weavon, hair extensions and jewellery to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase weavon, hair extensions and jewellery

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku Frieda is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcoholic beverages and is requesting a loan to purchase brewing materials. Kaku is 40 years old and is widowed. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a big bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase brewing materials

loans.name: Vicente Boavida

texts.pt:
Vicente Boavida N. de 64 anos de idade, nasceu na província de Gazao (a 240km de Maputo), casado oficial e pai de quatro filhos maiores de idade e estão todos a trabalhar.
Parou de estudar na segunda classe porque os seus progenitores não tinham condições financeiras. Não sustenta mais ninguém senao a esposa.

Chegou a boane a 48 anos a procura de melhores condições de vida e vive na casa do do estado com sua esposa. É funcionário do Governo a 30 anos e trabalha como servente da administradora do distrito de boane tendo salário mensal de 3.000,00mt.

Teve informações sobre a existência da hluvukua traves de amigos e nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00MT que pretende comprar material de construção. O primeiro crédito foi de 8.000,00Mt para compra de bens de consumo. 

Propõe se a pagar em harmonia com o plano de prestações para terminar cedo a sua casa que esta cosntruindo em fases, para depois mobiliar.
texts.en:
Vicente Boavida N. is 64 years old. He was born in the province of Gazao, 240 km from Maputo. He is married and has four adult children who are all working. He had to stop going to school in the second grade because of his parents' lack of financial resources. He doesn't support anyone else, apart from his wife. He came to Boane when he was 48, seeking improved quality of life, and he lives with his wife in government housing. He's been a civil servant for 30 years and works for the district administrator of Boane. He earns a monthly salary of 3000 meticals. He heard about Hluvuku through friends and has never obtained loans from other banks. This is his second loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he plans to use to purchase construction materials. His first loan was for 8000 meticals, which he used to buy consumer goods. He intends to pay off this loan in accordance with the loan schedule so he can finish the house he's building soon and be able to furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family house

loans.name: Lamota

texts.en: Lamota sells crates of drinks on a retail and wholesale basis to her customers. Lamota is 40 years old and married with six children. Lamota is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en:
Marriam J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to open a shop. Marriam is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a chief. She has one child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four sewing machines and rent a workshop

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en:
Abiodun sells bags of charcoal. She is 29 years old and married with two children. They live in Agbara, Lagos State. Abiodun hopes for a loan  of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. 
She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a typical businesswoman. She sells foodstuffs in her house. She is 39 years old and married with three children. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 
She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr: specialisee dans le domaine de la fripperie depuis 1990 ndeye F. est parent beneficiaire domiciliee a cambereneelle a toujour commercialise les habits de femmes.actuellements elle souhaiterait elargir ses ventes aux habits pour hommes.c'est ainsi que s'impose a elle la necessite d'augmenter ter son fond de roulement.elle emprunte le montant decent mille frs pour faire face a cette situation.
texts.en:
Specialized in the field of used clothing since 1990, Ndeye F. is a client parent living in Camberene. She has always been selling women’s clothing. She would like to expand her sales with men’s clothing, thus the need imposes itself upon her to augment her working capital. She is borrowing the amount of 100,000 francs to address this situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen sells foodstuffs and she lacks enough capital to boost her business. Helen is 30 years old and she has three children. Helen hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 
She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: marie V. est parent beneficiaire habitant camberene et commercialisant lapate d'arachide,un produit fdrtement utilise dans la consommation quotidienne des menages.elle a une experience dedix ans dans cette activite.par consequent elle emprunte cent mille frs pour pouvoir repondre favorablement a l'accroissement de la demande.
texts.en:
Marie V. is a client parent living in Camberene and marketing peanut butter, a highly-used product in daily household consumption. She has ten years of experience in this business. Consequently she is borrowing 100,000 francs to be able to respond favorably to the growth in demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Sor Erlinda Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Sor Erlinda tiene la edad de 42 años, reside en jardines de Veracruz en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos los cuales están cursando sus estudios, su esposo  trabaja de comerciante. El negocio de la señora Sor Erlinda es la venta de ropa usada con este negocio lleva siete años en las ventas, ella inicio este negocio con el deseo de superación para apoyar a su esposo con los gasto de la familia con dinero propio el cual inicio con la venta de prendas, pero luego comenzó a vender ropa usada ambulante. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de ropa variada nueva, para que sus clientes puedan tener las opciones de elegir a si como captar nuevos clientes. Sus planes para sus hijos es poderlos ayudar a que terminen sus estudios para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sor Erlinda is 42, and she lives in the Veracruz gardens in the capital city, Managua. She has two children who go to school. Her husband is a storekeeper. Sor Erlinda sells used clothes. She has been doing this for seven years. She started this business with the desire to succeed and help her husband with the family expenses. She started with her own money; she sold clothes. Then she started to sell used clothing as a street vendor. With this loan she will buy various new clothes so that her customers have a selection to choose from. This way she will get new customers. Her plan is to be able to help her children finish their education so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's, women's, and men's clothing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes sells palm oil to her customers. The demand for her palm oil is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Agnes is the mother of five and she is 32 years old and married. Agnes hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more palm oil to sell. 
She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou D. est parent beneficiaire depuis 1989.elle s'active dans la vente de jus et de glace.son objectif est de prendre des mesures d'accompagnement pour affronter la periode de la chaleur periode ou la demande est tres forte .par consequent ellle demnde un pret de soixante quinze mille frs.elle capitalise plus de sept d'experience dans cette activite.
texts.en:
Fatou D. has been a client parent since 1989. She is active in selling juices and ice cream. Her goal is to take supportive measures in face of periods of hot weather, when the demand is very high. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of 75,000 francs. She capitalizes on over seven years of experience in this business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Maria Jamileth

texts.es: Doña Maria Jamileth S., tiene la edad de 47 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa, lo cual espera lograr ya que su casa es de zinc y ya esta muy viejo e insegura. Su negocio es la venta de fritanga y destace de cerdo, que desde hace seis años inicio con préstamos. Con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer una pared de piedra y su cocina lo cual desea con mucho anhelo para tener una casa digna. a futuro es poder ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los créditos y por las mejoras que ha logrado.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Jamileth S. is 47 years old and a resident of the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has three adult children who live on their own. Her plans include completing the renovations to her zinc house, which is quite old and unsafe. Her business involves butchering pigs and preparing fried pork dishes for sale. She started her business six years ago with the help of loans.

This current loan will be used to purchase building materials to complete the stone walls of her kitchen, which will give her the decent home she greatly desires. In the future, Doña Maria would like to expand her food business. She thanks AFODENIC for supporting her with the loans and helping her succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Maria Esmeralda C., tiene la edad de 36 años, reside en la capital de Managua,  su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad que cursan la secundaria. Su negocio es la venta de perfumenes, este negocio lo inicio con prestamos y ahorros  vende al contado y al crédito, con este préstamo va invertir en la compra de mas productos ya que la demanda ha ido creciendo en los pedidos. Lo cual espera poder sastifacer a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias. Su meta para sus hijos es poder apoyarle para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria Esmeralda C., 36, lives in the capital city of Managua. Her husband works independently. She has two children; they are 12 and 13. They go to high school. She sells perfume. She started the business with loans and savings. She sells for cash and credit. With this loan she will buy more products. Her orders have been increasing. She hopes to be able to satisfy her customers and get better earnings. Her goal is to be able to support her children so that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Modisola

texts.en: Modisola sells clothes and shoes. Modisola is 30 years old and married without a child. She hopes for a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more shoes and clothes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi A. est est un jeune homme de 29 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il exerce ce métier depuis 3 ans. Yawo souhaite avec ce crédit acheter sa propre moto
texts.en:
Koffi A. is a young man, 29 years old, and unmarried, and he has no children. He is a motorbike taxi driver in Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been working at this trade for three years. He wishes to use this loan to buy his own motorbike.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorbike taxi

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty, 36 years old, is married with two children and one adopted child, who are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in maize, oranges and avocado. She has been retailing for the past eight years and has been very resourceful for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of maize, oranges and avocado to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes in her ability to increase her profit margin with the loan funds.

loans.use: To purchase products in bulk

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza U. es una mujer luchadora con deseo de superación, para obtener ingreso y apoyar a su esposo que trabaja como guarda de seguridad y su salario es bajo opto por cuidar niños en su casa y así salir adelante con su familia. Tiene 48 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, con los ahorro ha invertido en la compra de ropa, chinelas y otros productos para ayudarse mas. Su meta es poder seguir construyendo su casa. Este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos ya que tiene varios en cargo y quiere crecer en inventario y ventas para obtener mayor beneficio. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros obtenidos.
texts.en:
Esperanza U. is a fighter with the desire to succeed and get an income in order to help her husband. He works as a security guard, and his salary is very low. She decided to take care of children in her house. That way she can help her family get ahead. She is 48, and she lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital city of Managau. She used her savings to buy clothes, slippers, and other things to be of more help. Her goal is to be able to continue building her house. This is her sixth loan cycle with Afodenic. She will use the loan to buy clothes and shoes. She has various orders, and she wants to increase her inventory and sales to get a greater benefit. She is grateful to the institution for the achieved successes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and footwear

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade sells drinks in her shop. As a widow, life has not been too easy for her and her four children. Folashade is 40 years old. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: khady N. est vendeuse de petit dejeuner.elle est parent beneficiaire,elle habite camberene.elle a une experience de dix ans.elle sollicite un pret decent mille pour faire face a la forte demande a laquelle elle est confrontee.
texts.en:
Khady N. is a breakfast-seller. She is a client parent. She lives in Camberene. She has ten years of experience. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to address the strong demand with which she is confronted.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Tate

texts.fr: Tate K. est un jeune homme de 30 anc, marié et père de 3 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé. K. exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto. cette aubaine lui permettra de dégager des bénéfices pour la survie de sa famille
texts.en:
Tate K. is a thirty-year-old man who is married and the father of three children. He is a motorcycle taxi driver in Womé, Togo. K. has worked in this sector for four years and would like to have a loan to buy a new motorcyle. This good fortune would help K. support his family.

Translated from French by Andrew Whiteman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Luisa Ercilia

texts.es: La señora Luisa Ercilia tiene la edad de 52 años, se dedica a la venta de fritanga desde hace diecinueve años,  el cual inicio con dinero que su esposo dio,  reside en un bario Máximo Jerez en la capital de Managua, , su esposo labora como asistente en una empresa privada, tiene tres hijos de 3,18 y 31 años de edad, el mayor es independiente, y los dos estudian. Sus planes es poder invertir más en el negocio en la compra de mesas y sillas para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y atraer clientes nuevos. Con este crédito va a comprar carnes y granos básicos para preparar sus ricos platillo de comida. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de los préstamos y plazo que nos benefician para crecer en nuestro negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa Ercilia is 52 years old and has had her own business selling fritanga (traditional Nicaraguan fried foods) for the past 19 years. Her husband provided the start-up capital for the business. She lives in the Máximo Jerez neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her husband works as an assitant at a private company, and the couple has three children, who are 13, 18, and 31 years old. Their oldest son is independent, while the younger two are in school. In the future, Luisa plans to invest in her business by buying tables and chairs in order to better serve her current clients and also draw in new clients. She will use this loan to buy meat and basic grains to prepare her delicious meals. She is thankful to Afodenic for giving her the opportunity to take out loans on terms that benefit her by allowing her to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat and basic grains

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu sells foodstuffs in her shop. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, two sons and three daughters. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer. Comfort is a food vendor. She prepares and sells groundnut toffees. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside from morning to evening. Comfort wants a loan to buy bags of groundnuts and other ingredients such as sugar in bulk. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for twelve years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.fr: Dzifa D. est une femme de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle réside  à Womé. Dzifa désire avec ce crédit ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale, un commerce qu’elle a tant rêvé réalisé. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Il faut noter que la vue est prise dans un petit jardin qu’elle tient non loin de sa maison.
texts.en:
Dzifa D. is a 36-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three. She resides in Womé. She would like to use this loan to open a general store, a business she has dreamed of having so very much. She is counting on this opportunity to change her family’s living conditions. It should be noted that the snapshot was taken in a small garden she has, not far from her house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease a store and to stock it

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: Doña Albertina O., es docente de la secundaria desde muy joven comenzó a dar clase, también vende cosméticos a sus compañeras de trabajo, y al publico en general al contado y al crédito de la quincena. Tiene 45 años de edad, reside en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Jericó tiene dos hermosos hijas una casada y una que estudia. Sus planes es apoyar a su hija para que concluya sus estudios, y pueda tener un nivel de vida mejor, con este crédito va a comprar cerámica para poner en la sala, este es su sexto ciclo el cual da las gracias ala institución  por el  apoyo ya que a través de estos préstamo ha podido hacer mejoras a su casa y así dar seguridad y estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Albertina O. has been a high school teacher since she was very young. She also sells cosmetics to her co-workers and to the general public for payments in cash or on credit (monthly or bi-weekly). She is 45 years old and lives in the Jérico neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has two beautiful daughters; one is married, while the other is in school. Albertina plans to continue to support her daughter so that she can finish her studies and improve her quality of life. With this loan, Albertina will buy floor tiles for her living room. This is her sixth loan cycle, and she thanks the institution for its support. Thanks to these loans, she has been able to make home improvements and provide her family with security and stability.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy floor tiles for living room

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort K. is 41 years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son, who is currently in the senior high school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Comfort’s husband is an electrician and she is a trader. She trades in printed textile goods, ready-made clothes, bags, and footwear for both males and females. Comfort hawks to sell and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale is business oriented. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. Bolale is 36 years old and married with six children. Bolale hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Mensah

texts.en: Mensah G. is 44 years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl who are currently in the senior high and the primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. His wife is a trader. Mensah is also a trader. He trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. He buys his goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in his community. He supplies to food vendors and retailers. Mensah also treks to other markets to sell. He has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He aspires to expand his business and sponsor his children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Célestine D. est âgé de 26 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de produits pharmaceutiques à Womé. Célestine exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans et elle est à son premier crédit. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit relancer son activité en achetant de nouveaux produits afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Célestine D. is 26 years old, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of pharmaceutical products in Womé. She has been in this business for four years, and she is on her first loan. She would like to use this loan to reinvigorate her business by buying new products in order to respond to customer needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new goods

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia G. is 34 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a girl who are both in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a trader. Cecilia also trades. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. Cecilia also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor all her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Herminda Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Herminia del Carmen tiene la edad de 41 año, casada, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo es cadete de taxi, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace seis años inicio con apoyo de su esposo, procreo tres hijos dos independiente y uno estudia. Sus planes para la familia es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, como apoyar a su hija para que estudie. Con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en la compra de granos básicos, productos enlatados, lácteos para tener productos variados y ofrecer a sus clientes. Con esta inversión espera crecer y obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de brindar préstamo a plazos accesibles para crecer en su negocio lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia del Carmen is 41 years and married. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. Her husband is a taxi driver, and they have three children, two of whom are independent and one of whom is still studying. She has been running her own small grocery store for the past six years. Her goals for the future of her family are to improve her home and to continue to support her daughter in her studies. She will use this loan to buy basic grains, canned goods and dairy products so that she will have a wide variety of products to offer her clients. With this investment, she hopes to expand her business and earn more in profits. She thanks Afodenic for giving her the opportunity to take out loans on accessible terms in order to expand her business, which have been very beneficial for her.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, canned goods and dairy products

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence T. is not married but a mother of one child, a boy who is currently in the primary school. She is 27 years old. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a fishmonger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. Florence buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes the fish herself. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her child the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Ever Jose

texts.es: El señor Ever José M., trabaja en un restaurante como jefe de mesero, desde hace ocho años labora, abecés difícil por que sale muy noche de trabajar y se le hace cansado, pero con buenas propinas que dejan los clientes, tiene 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad, que estudian la primaria. Con este crédito va invertir en materiales de construcción para hacer una pared de concreto de la casa para tener seguridad para su familia. Sus objetivos es lograr poner su propio negocio para poder estar mejor económicamente y poder terminar de hacer su casa, como poder dar estudios a sus hijas para que sean profesionales. Da las gracias Afodenic por los préstamos otorgados ya que a través de ellos ha mejorado su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ever José M. has worked as the head waiter of a restaurant for eight years. It is sometimes difficult because he leaves late at night for work and it makes him tired, but the customers leave him good tips.
He is 41 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighbourhood in the capital, Managua. He and his wife have two children aged 10 and 12 who are in primary school. With this loan he will purchase building materials to build a concrete wall around his house for his family’s security.
His goals are to set up his own business to improve his economic situation, to complete construction on his house and to educate his daughters so that they have careers. He thanks Afodenic for the loans he has received because through them he has improved his life and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials for a concrete wall

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha O. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one boy and two girls. All are currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a commercial driver. 

Martha is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside from morning to evening. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Martha buys her goods from Kumasi and has been in business for five years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Fummi

texts.en: Fummi sells foodstuffs. Fummi is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra A. est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. elle désire avec ce crédit aménager sa boutique pour contenir augmenter sa capacité et l'alimenter.
texts.en:
Abra A. is a 42–year-old woman, married, and the mother of five. She runs a general store in Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She would like to use this loan to fix up her shop to accommodate the increasing of the shop’s capacity and to stock it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up her store and to stock it

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Diouldé, 22 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt pour louer une boutique et l’approvisionner en marchandise. L’activité est menée avec l’appui de son mari. Elle veut contribuer à l’entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Diouldé, age 22, is married and has three children in her care. She is requesting a loan to lease a shop and to supply it with merchandise. This business is managed with her husband’s support. She wants to help with maintaining her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease and to supply a shop

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua S. is seventy years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six children: two sons and four daughters. According to her, all her children are out of school and working. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Akosua is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells them in the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. She also treks to other markets to sell her cereals. Akosua has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor all her children to complete their education.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Rodecinda

texts.es:
Rodecinda es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Rodecinda es casada, tiene 10 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, Rodecinda se dedica a la compra D. tara, cochinilla, D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a sus hijas. Además Rodecinda viaja  a las ferias los días sábados y domingos a comprar tara.
Rodecinda necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tara y cochinilla.
Los sueños D. Rodecinda es mejorar su negocio, que su ultimo hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rodecinda is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Rodecinda is married, and has 10 children, 6 of which live with her. Rodecinda dedicates herself to selling Tara (an ornamental plant and a source of tannins), and Cochineal insects (used for crimson-colored dye) as an ambulant vendor in the Magdalena market; she carries out this activity every day with her daughters. In addition, Rodecinda travels to markets on Saturdays and Sunday to purchase Tara. Rodencinda needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of Tara and Cochineal. Rodecinda dreams of improving her business, and that her last son finish his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Tara (an ornamental plant and a source of tannins), and Cochineal insects (used for crimson-colored dye).

loans.name: Régine

texts.fr: Régine E. est une femme de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de jus de fruits et tient aussi le commerce des cartes de recharge. Elle désire avec ce crédit acroître la taille de son commerce surtout celui des cartes de recharge dont elle veut faire des livraisons en gros. Elle compte sur cette aubaine pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Régine E. is a 38-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of fruit juices and also runs a business selling mobile phone recharge cards. She would like to use this loan to expand her business, especially in recharge cards, which she wants to deliver in bulk. She is counting on this great opportunity to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recharge cards for resale

loans.name: Ama
