texts.en: Ama A. is fifty–one years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: two sons and four daughters who are in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a carpenter. Ama is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize and vegetables. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells them in the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. Ama also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Ama aspires to expand her business and sponsor all her children to complete their education.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella sells second-hand clothes and bags. Stella is 47 years old and married with 4 children. Stella hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes and bags to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel  es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Ysabel es casada, tiene 62 años y 12 hijos, Ysabel viaja a las ferias D. la región 5 veces a la semana en donD. venD. ropa variada y D. las ferias compra cereales, quesos que venD. en su barrio. Además Ysabel tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo e hijos. Ysabel también confecciona ropa típica.
Ysabel necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. uniformes escolares, faldas, mandiles.
Los sueños D. Ysabel son comprar una maquina industrial para su taller.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Ysabel is married, 62 years old, and has 12 children. Ysabel travels to regional markets 5 times a week where she sells various clothing items and from the markets she purchases grains, and cheese that she sells in her neighborhood. In addition, Ysabel has a small grocery store in her home, which she runs with her husband and children. Ysabel also makes traditional clothing. Ysabel needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of school clothing, skirts, and aprons. Ysabel dream is to purchase an industrial machine for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of school clothing, skirts, and aprons.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Julia es casada, tiene 64 años y 7 hijos, Julia es panificadora, tiene un horno artesanal D. leña en su casa, en donD. elabora panes típicos como la chapla, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado cercano a su casa.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina, azúcar y levadura.
Los sueños D. Julia son educar a su ultima hija y comprar maquinas para implementar su panadería.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Julia is married, 64 years old, and has 7 children. Julia makes bread, and has a handcrafted wood oven in her home where she makes traditional breads like Chapla. She carries out her sales in the market near her house. Julia needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, and yeast. Julia’s dreams are to educate her last daughter and to purchase machinery to open a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of flour, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is a widowed mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. Some are still in school – junior high and the primary schools. She is seventy years old. Mary lives with her children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. Mary supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell as well. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Gladis es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Gladys tiene cabinas de Internet en un local alquilado, además brinda servicio de digitación, impresión, negocio que inicio hace 4 meses. Anteriormente vendía frutas pero cambio de negocio porque tenia pocas ganancias. Gladys tiene proyectado implementar su negocio con la venta de golosinas.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vitrina y dulces.
Los sueños de Gladys son tener una tienda mas grande y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Gladys lives with her partner, is 26 years old, and has 1 child. Gladys has Internet booths in a rented locale, and she also offers typing and printing services. She opened this business 4 months ago. Previously she sold fruit but she changed businesses because she made little profits. Gladys is planning on adding to her business the sale of sweets. Gladys needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of a display case and sweets. Gladys dreams of having a bigger store and building a home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of a display case and sweets.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children: two sons and five daughters who are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in meat, which she sells on a table top at the market square. She also supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. Elizabeth buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for thirty years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk. Elizabeth wants to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy meat to sell

loans.name: Tacheyomigbachi Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Isatu K. and Kadiatu S.. They named their group Tache Yo M’Gbachi, a Temne phrase meaning "Let us be firm". They are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these women are receiving from SMT/Kiva. They want a loan to help them develop their businesses, because they have seen how microloans have been helping others’ businesses grow.

Isatu K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of the group. Isatu is thirty-two years old. She was born in Makeni, is married to a motor driver and they have four children. Two of their children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. Isatu sells dishes, bowls and other plastic items. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. With this loan, she will travel to neighboring Guinea to buy more goods to sell. Goods are usually cheaper in neighboring Guinea.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Dora Bernardina

texts.es:
Dora es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Dora es separada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Dora es panificadora, elabora panes típicos de la zona como la chapla, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena.
Dora necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y azúcar.
Los sueños de Dora son tener un horno propio y culminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Dora is separated, 56 years old, and has 6 children. Dora is a bread maker, and makes traditional breads of the area, such as Chapla; Dora carries out this activity in a rented oven, and her sales are carried out as an ambulant vendor in the Magdalena market. Dora needs a loan of 1,500 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour and sugar. Dora dreams of having her own oven, and finishing the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of flour and sugar.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina sells drinks and juice in her shop. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. Justina is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia M., also known as Akosua, is forty–eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: a son and two daughters who are in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer and she is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, and also textiles and fabrics. She buys her goods from nearby communities and Kumasi, and sells at the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. Cecilia also treks to other markets to sell her goods. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor all her children to complete their education.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es:
Gertrudes es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Gertrudes es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Gertrudes vive en la comunidad de Pampa Cangallo que se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Además Gertrudes se dedica a la compra de quesos en su comunidad y lo comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Gertrudes necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Gertrudes son construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Gertrudes is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Gertrudes is married, 40 years old, and 5 children; Gertrudes lives in the Pampa Cangallo community that is located 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho, where she has a small grocery store. In addition Gertrudes dedicates herself to the purchase of cheeses from her community, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Gertrudes needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of cheeses. Gertrudes dreams of building her house in the city of Ayacucho and stocking her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi Y. est un jeune homme de 29 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé depuis 3 ans. Kossi souhaita avec ce crédit acheter son propre engin. Il utilisait depuis lors la moto d’autrui ce qui ne lui permettait pas d’épargner pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Kossi compte su cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi Y., age 29, is married and the father of one child. He's been a motorcycle taxi driver in Womé for 3 years. Kossi would like to use this loan to buy his own motorcycle. Until know, he's been using an other person's motorcycle, which does not enable him to save to provide for his family. Kossi counts on this opportunity to improve the standard of living of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark O. is twenty-nine years old. He is married and has one son who is currently in the primary school. He lives with his wife and son in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town. His wife trades. Mark is a cobbler by profession. He makes all kinds of footwear, such as shoes, slippers, and sandals, for both men and women. His workshop is located at the road side. Mark procures his working materials from Kumasi. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy more materials.

loans.use: To buy leather and shoe soles

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Nelly es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Nelly tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Nelly son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Communal Bank Llapanchik, which means All Together in Quechua. Nelly lives with her partner, is 37 years old, and has 1 child. Nelly has a small neighborhood store in her house where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and fruits; she carries out this activity every day with the help of her husband. Nelly needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Nelly dreams are that her children become professional, and to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia A. is twenty–one years old. She is divorced and has one child, a son who is currently in the primary school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Afia trades in clothes. She deals in ready-made clothes such as jeans for both men and women. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the market square in her community. Afia treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy clothes in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her son the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta S., âgée de 44 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Son activité est la restauration. Elle veut acheter des provisions (viande, huile, charbon de bois et autres produits)pour renforcer son activité et améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Fanta S., age 44, is married and has three children in her care. She is in the restaurant business. She wants to buy some provisions (meat, oil, charcoal, and other goods) to bolster her business and to improve her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provision for her restaurant business

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Sorbeh group, Adama Kamara, Sallay T. and Marie K.. They are businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. These women have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan in order to boost their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses in terms of both quality and quantity. This will in turn enable them make better sales, more profit and improve on their standard of living. 

Adama K. (pictured at left) is the leader of this group. Adama was born in Makeni about thirty-three years ago. She is married to a tailor and they have four children together. One of their children is now in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III), and the others are in primary school. Adama sells sugar, rice, palm-oil and other goods. She has been a businesswoman for five years now.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Berta es separada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Berta viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra quesos, cereales, animales menores, productos que comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Berta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa y queso.
Los sueños de Berta son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Berta is a member of the Communal Bank Llapanchik, which means All Together in Quechua. Berta is separated, 35 years old, and has 2 children. Berta travels to regional markets where she purchases cheeses, grains, and small animals, products that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Berta needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of potatoes and cheese. Berta’s dreams are to educate her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de papa y queso.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Julia es casada, tiene 42 años y 7 hijos, Julia viaja a las ferias D. L. región 2 veces por semana en donD. compra quesos, animales, papa, productos que comercializa en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. papa y queso.
Los sueños D. Julia son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank Llapanchik, which means All Together in Quechua. Julia is married, 42 years old, and has 7 children. Julia travels to the regional markets twice a week where she purchases cheeses, animals, and potatoes, products that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Julia needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of potatoes and cheese. Julia’s dreams are to educate her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by MarieL. Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and cheese.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina O. is a divorced mother of one child, a son who is currently in the senior high school. She is forty years old. Georgina lives with her son in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell as well. Georgina buys bags of flour from Kumasi. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. Georgina desires to expand her business and give her son a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is twenty–eight years old. She is married and has two children - one girl and one boy, who are both in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. Theresa is a trader. She trades in jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, and rings. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. Theresa has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy jewelry in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Florentina es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Florentina se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos como el queso, tiene ganado vacuno del cual obtiene la leche y también compra de otros productores, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Florentina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche.
Los sueños de Florentina es tener una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the communal bank “Llapanchik” which means “All Together” in Quechua. Florentina is married, 38 years old, and has four children. She makes milk products like cheese for a living. She gets the milk both from her cattle and also from other producers and sells her products in the markets of Ayacucho. Florentina needs a loan of 1,000 soles to by milk. She dreams of having a grocery store and of her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de leche.

loans.name: Elia Mariella

texts.es: Elia Mariella Aróstegui Dávila tiene la edad de 37 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Elia es la venta de productos de belleza. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Elia tiene clientes muy buenos, es una mujer muy luchadora, los pedidos de sus productos los realiza 2 veces al mes, las ventas las efectúa recorriendo las calles y lo que son clientes conocidos visitan su vivienda para apreciar mejor la calidad de sus utilidades, Elia inicio con muy poca mercadería como tratamientos para el cabello, cremas para la piel y al ver que este negocio era rentable decide mantenerlo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, tratamientos para la piel y cremas. El sueño de Elia es que las personas que brindan ayuda necesaria, para que personas como ellas, puedan salir adelante con su negocio y continúen contribuyendo para mejorar las condiciones del país.
texts.en:
Elia Mariella Aróstegui Dávila is 37 years old and has two dependent children. Elia has made a living selling beauty products for over eleven years. She is a hard working woman and has great clients. Elia orders her products twice a month and then walks the streets selling them. Clients who know her, visit her home in order to look over the best of what she has to sell. Elia started out with limited merchandise only selling products like hair treatments and skin creams. Since this was a profitable business, she decided to stay with it. The loan she is requesting is for working capital to buy perfumes and skin treatments and creams. Elisa’s dream is that people keep helping to improve her country by helping people like her get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora María del Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futura II”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años, 03 hijos y 02 
 aún dependen de ella.

María del Pilar, lleva ya varios años dedicando a la venta de mercería, pasamanería y grandes novedades en forma ambulatoria, nos cuenta que siempre deseaba implementar su propio negocio, por esto decidió sacar un préstamo y fue el Movimiento Manuela Ramos quien  la apoyo con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, organizando y surtiendo así su negocio  en su misma casa. 

Hoy en día, continúa con el mismo negocio e implemento también sus ventas de artículos de higiene y cuenta con una clientela fija, que diariamente realizan sus compras y como también va ofreciendo a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera ingresos, y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando mas productos para vender como: cremas, betunes, pasta dentales en diferentes marcas, Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de algunos productos de higiene personal  como: serenas, papel higiénico, shampoos.

Pilarcita, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. María del Pilar is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres para el Futuro II.” She lives in Tarapoto in San Martín. María is married, 43 years old, and has three children two of whom are dependents. As an ambulatory vendor, María del Pilar had been selling haberdashery, trims and tassels, and novelties for many years. She tells us that she always wanted to have her own business so she decided to take out a loan and came to Movimiento Manuela Ramos who helped her with her first loan of 300 soles. This is how she was able to organize and stock a business in her home. Today, she has the same business and also sells personal hygiene products. She has a loyal clientele who buy from her every day, and who also tell their friends and neighbors about her products. It is going very well and she earns something each month. She gets sales by word of mouth because she is so charming. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she would like to buy more products to sell like: creams, shoe polish, and various brands of toothpaste. She will also invest part of the money in the purchase of personal hygiene products like: toilet paper, and shampoos. Pilarcita is very happy with what she has achieved because her business is doing very well. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her, and the many other women who want to be business women, get started.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara mas merceria

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Lucia es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Lucia se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos como el queso, la leche lo adquiere de productores, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche.
Los sueños de Lucia son construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the “Llapanchik” communal bank, which means “Everyone Together” in Quechua. Lucia is married, she is 39 years old, and she has 4 children. She makes dairy products, such as cheese. She buys the milk from milk producers. She sells her products at markets in the city of Ayacucho. Lucia needs a loan of 1500 PEN, which she will use to buy milk. Lucia’s dreams are to build her house and that her children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia A. is twenty–six years old. She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Both are currently in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works as a farmer and Afia is a food vendor. Afia prepares and sells porridge. She sells it at the lorry station in the mornings. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Afia has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Candelaria es separada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Candelaria tiene un kiosko dentro del estadio de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende golosinas y bebidas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Candelaria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
Los sueños de Candelaria son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member of the “Llapanchik” communal bank, which means “Everyone Together” in Quechua. Candelaria is separated, she is 42 years old, and she has 2 children. She has a kiosk inside the stadium in the city of Ayacucho where she sells sweets and soft drinks, which she does with her children’s help. Candelaria needs a loan of 1200 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of sweets and soft drinks. Candelaria’s dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets and soft drinks

loans.name: Orestes

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92754&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Orestes es socio del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando. 
Orestes tiene una carpintería metálica, se llama  P., su taller es alquilado.
En finca aprendió ser responsable, puntual en los pagos 
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para comprar ángulos, platina, fieros.
El sueño de Orestes es que su hija termine su carrera, y terminar de construir  su casa.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92754&_tpos=... Orestes is a member of the Mujeres Progresando (Women Getting Ahead) communal bank. He has a metal shop by the name of P.. He rents his shop location. With Finca he learned to be responsible and punctual in his payments. He needs a loan of 2000 PEN to buy metal angles, metal plate, and tools. Orestes’ dream is to finish building his house and also for his daughter to finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal angles, metal plate, and tools

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia D. is a divorced mother of two children, a boy and a girl. Both are currently in the primary school. She is twenty–seven years old. Afia lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Afia trades in pastries. She makes pastries in her community. She supplies to other retailers in her community and hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi. Afia has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Nancy Delfina

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92758&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Nancy es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Nancy se dedica a la venta de tamales, es un negocio familiar, sus padres hacían tamales, sus abuelos también hacían tales es un negocio de generación
Su hijo mayor también participa de la elaboración.. 
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de maíz, hoja de plátano, y todo lo que es necesario.
Desde que Nancy entro a  Finca encontró gran ayuda, financiera por  los prestamos que realizan.
El sueño de Nancy es darle lo mejor a sus hijos y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy's first loan is located here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92758&_tpos=6&_tpg=1 Nancy is a member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Progresando" (Women Progressing). She makes a living by selling tamales, which is a family business. Her parents used to sell tamales, and her grandparents also made them. Her oldest son also helps make them. Nancy needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase corn, banana leaves, and everything that she needs to make her tamales. Since Nancy started working with Finca, she has found them to be a great financial help because of the loans they offer. Nancy's dream is to give the best to her children and to grow in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and banana leaves

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata B., âgée de 51 ans est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge. Son activité est la restauration. Elle veut la  promouvoir. Cette activité lui a permis de réaliser la construction d’un restaurant.
texts.en:
Aminata B., 51, is married and responsible for 2 children. Her business is serving cooked food. She wants to promote it. This business has permitted her to effect the construction of a restaurant.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintaining her business selling cooked food

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92760&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Elva  es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Hace tres años  se quedo sin trabajo, empezó vendiendo dos cajas de cerveza con mucho temor de que no le compren, en la puerta de su casa, hoy en día se dedica a la venta de Cerveza en su casa.
Elva necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, para la compra de cajas de cerveza, de varias marcas, franca, Trujillo.
Desde que está en Finca, su negocio se ha crecido mas, vende más porque cuenta con mas capital.
El sueño de Elva es alquilar un local y poner un depósito de cerveza.
texts.en:
Elva's first loan is located here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92760&_tpos=6&_tpg=1 Elva is a member of the communal bank, "Avancemos Juntas." Three years ago, she was left without a job, so she started selling two cases of beer with a lot of fear that no one would buy from her. She sold them in front of her house, and today she sells beer in her house. Elva needs a loan of 1,800 PEN to purchase cases of beer of different brands. Since she has worked with Finca, her business has grown. She sells more because she has more capital. Elva's dream is to rent a store and to start a beer warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beer of different brands

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia B. is forty–six years old. She is widowed and has five children, two sons and three daughters, who are currently in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Leticia is a trader. She trades in meat. She sells on a table top at the market square. She also supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Leticia has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Adela es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Adela tiene un recreo turístico llamado Gallo de Oro, en donde vende bebidas, comidas típicas, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos. Además alquila el local para diferentes eventos y compromisos, Adela tiene proyectado construir un hotel.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción.
Los sueños de Adela son terminar de construir su hotel y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the communal bank, "Violeta." She is married, is 42, and has 4 children. Adela owns a tourist destination called "Gallo de Oro," where she sells beverages and traditional food. She does this on Saturdays and Sundays. She also rents a location for different events. Adela plans to build a hotel. She needs a loan of 1,800 PEN that will be invested in construction materials. Adela's dreams are to finish building her hotel and to see her son become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Jesus Jackeline

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Jesús es madre soltera, tiene 28 años tiene un hijo de 2 años, que lo cuida.
Jesús trabajaba limpiando casas, lo dejo por que salió embarazada    y se fue a vivir con su esposo pero a los dos años la abandono y se puso a vender cerveza y gaseosas en la puerta de su casa.
Desde que Jesús esta en Finca, ha encontrado un apoyo y una solución a su economía, tiene un negocio y puede invertir.  
Jesús necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de cervezas, gaseosas y golosinas.
El sueño de Jesús es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Progresando." She is a single mother, is 28, and has a 2-year-old son she cares for. Jesús used to work cleaning houses, but she stopped doing this when she became pregnant and went to live with her husband. He abandoned her two years ago, and she started to sell beer and soft drinks in front of her house. Since Jesús has worked with Finca, she has found support and a solution to her financial problems. She has a business and knows how to invest. She needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase beer, soft drinks, and candy. Her dream is to have her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer, soft drinks, and candy

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José Santos R. Martínez tiene la edad de 45 años, es hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad a la que José se dedica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio.  Anteriormente José vendía ropa, calzado entre otras cosas, pero debido a un sin numero de problemas por los que atravesaba tenia que dejar este tipo de negocio, ya que viajaba mucho y sus hijos y su esposa pasaban mucho tiempo solos, y José es un hombre muy responsable y siempre le ha gustado mantenerse cerca de su familia. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y no perder este negocio que tanto le gusta e invertir en la compra de frijoles, maíz, cacao y tamarindo. Su sueño es establecer un negocio para su esposa para que ella pueda obtener una fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
José Santos R. Martínez is 45, is married, and has 2 children. He has sold basic grains for more than 6 years. Previously José sold clothing, shoes, and other items, but due to countless problems he decided to leave this business. He had to travel a lot and his children and wife were spending a lot of time alone. José is a very responsible man, and he has always like to stay close to his family. This is why he requesting financing for working capital so he won't lose his business that he likes so much. He will invest in the purchase of beans, corn, cocoa, and tamarinds. His dream is to establish a business for his wife so she can have a source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Rufina es casada, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Rufina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, bebidas, además Rufina viaja a la feria de Paras en donde vende abarrotes y de la feria compra quesos y animales menores.
Rufina necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Rufina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rufina is a member of the communal bank, "Violeta." She is married, is 45, and has 2 children. Rufina has a store in her home where she sells general groceries like vegetables, meats, drinks, and other items. Rufina travels to the market in Paras where she sells groceries, and at the market she purchases cheeses and small animals. Rufina needs a loan of 1,600 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Rufina's dreams are to see her children become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena Amonsah is a divorced mother of three children - two sons and one daughter, who are all currently in the primary school. She is thirty–four years old. Abena lives with her children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a baker and a food vendor. She fries doughnuts and sells them in her community. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell as well. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. Abena desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour to make doughnuts.

loans.name: Rosa Leonidas

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Rosalía tiene 69 años y 8 hijos, Rosalía tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrote en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Rosalía necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños D. Rosalía son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the Violet Communal Bank. She is 69 years old and has eight children. Rosalia has a market in her house where she sells groceries and drinks. She operates her store everyday with her children’s assistance. Rosalia needs a loan of eight hundred soles in order to buy rice and sugar. Rosalia’s dream is to improve her business

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. is thirty–five years old. She is divorced and has five children - four sons and one daughter. All are currently in the primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Leticia is a food vendor. She roasts and sells ripped plantain, yam and fresh maize. She roasts and sells on a coal pot by the road side. She wants a loan to buy food stuffs in bulk. Leticia buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for nine years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy plantain, yam and fresh maize

loans.name: Yudith Mercedes

texts.es:
Yudith es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Yudith es soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Yudith es Cosmiatra, tiene un centro de masaje y tratamiento en su casa, tiene clientes fijos, brinda servicios de tratamiento de piel, reducciones, entre otros tratamientos. Yudith además tiene una lavandería en su casa para lo cual tiene un personal que se encarga de la atención.
Yudith necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cremas para los tratamientos.
Los sueños de Yudith son tener un spa bien implementado y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Violet Communal Bank. She is single, 25 years old and has one daughter. Judith is a cosmetologist. She has a massage and treatment center in her house. She provides her steady customers with skin treatments as well as other cosmetic treatments. Judith also has a Laundromat in her house. She has an employee that manages the Laundromat. Judith needs a loan of six hundred soles that she will use to purchase creams for her skin treatments. Judith’s dreams are to have a well-equipped spa and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase creams for her skin treatments

loans.name: Vany Manuel

texts.es: Vany Manuel R. C. tiene la edad de 40 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo y con muchos sacrificios todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de pescado. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por que Vany no poseía un trabajo para mantener a su familia, por lo que decide instruirse en el en la pesca artesanal, por lo que no fue nada fácil ya que el no poseía conocimientos de pesca pero el deseo de superación y salir adelante le ayudaron con su trabajo. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de pescado como pargo, curvina, camarones y chuletas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es conseguir un lugar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Vany Manuel R. C. is forty years old. He is married and has five children that he supports. With much sacrifice, the children are all able to study. Vany has been selling fish for twenty years. In the beginning Vany did not earn enough to support his family. This is why he decided to focus on specialty fish. It wasn’t easy because he did not know a lot about fish. His drive and the desire to succeed helped his business. The purpose of this loan is to allow him to purchase fish such as porgy, corvine and shrimp as well as other things. He wishes to find a place to sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Youngest Group

texts.en:
Here is Abass B., Zainab C. and Fatmata K.. They are small scale business people based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group Youngest. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

Abass (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. Abass was born in Yele, forty miles from Makeni and he is tweny-seven years of age. He is married with only one child who is still a baby. Abass sells ready-to-wear-clothes like jeans and T-shirts. He also sells sneakers.  Abass has been in business for three years now.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en:
Arifa F. is 45 years old and has raised four children.

She has been raising cattle for three years, and the business income allows her to provide for the basic needs of her family. Her husband and children all take part in the farm work and help Arifa pour water and cut grass for the animals. Arifa has been delighted with the recent growth in her cattle farm and is enthusiastic about investing further. She is seeking a loan to buy more young cattle in order to expand her business and earn more.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Mayda

texts.es:
Mayda es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Mayda es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Mayda viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende ropa variada, sus productos los comercializa de manera ambulatoria en diferentes ferias de la selva.
Mayda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de faldas, pantalones.
Los sueños de Mayda son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayda is a member of the Violeta Microfinance Institute.

Mayda is a 36-year-old married mother with 4 children. She travels to the Ayacucho jungle, where she sells assorted apparel. She sells her merchandise as a street vendor throughout the different markets of the jungle.

Mayda needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing skirts and pants.

She dreams of having her own house built and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase skirts and pants

loans.name: Djidéré

texts.fr: Djidéré D., 54 est mère de 07 enfants avec 04 petits fils en charge. Elle s’active dans la restauration et la vente de légumes. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre de renforcer ses activités pour améliorer ses revenus et prendre en charge la scolarité de ses  2 filles.
texts.en:
Djidéré D., age 54, is the mother of seven and has four grandsons to support. She is active in the restaurant business and in selling vegetables. The loan she is requesting will enable her to bolster her businesses, so as to improve her revenues and to cover schooling costs for two daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions for a restaurant busines and to sell vegetables

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. sells cosmetics such as body spray, powder, pomade, cream, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well.

Agnes is 40 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children--one son and three daughters who are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana.

Agnes has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Marziyya

texts.en:
Marziyya K. is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family.

Twelve years ago, Marziyya got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Her son helps her with the business.

With an endless list of requests, Marziyya has finally decided to increase the number of animals she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $2,000. Marziyya is counting on you for your help!

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Rita Mercedes

texts.es: Rita Mercedes R. Hernández tiene la edad de 59 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos el pan de cada día, a pesar de la edad y las enfermedades Rita es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable, por lo que decide salir a las calles a ofrecer productos como ropa interior y perfumes, Rita no posee niveles académicos por lo que se ve obligada a buscar de cualquier forma el trabajo y se gana la vida de una forma humilde pero honrada. Y es por ese motivo que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa interior y cosméticos. El sueño de Rita es que sus hijos tengan la posibilidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Rita Mercedes R. Hernández is a 59-year-old married mother with 3 children. She has been selling general merchandise for a living for 7 years. She started her business out of the need to provide her children with their daily bread. Despite her age and ailments, Rita is a responsible and hardworking woman, which is why she takes to the streets to sell products like undergarments and perfume. She does not have an education, so she has to take any type of employment she can get, earning a humble but respectable living. For this reason, she is seeking a loan that she will use as business capital to purchase footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. Rita dreams of her children having the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. sells utensils and all kinds of rubber products. She buys her goods (sets of utensils) from Kumasi and sells at the market square in her community. Afia hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for over 25 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Afia is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children--a son and two daughters who are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. She wants to expand her business and give her children all the support they need.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Sandra es soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Sandra vende golosinas y canchas de manera ambulatoria en el parque de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Además Sandra trabaja en un restaurante como ayudante.
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Sandra sueña con construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Violeta Microfinance Institute.

Sandra is a 21-year-old single mother with 1 son. She sells candy and popcorn as a street vendor at the Ayacucho city park. Additionally, Sandra works as an assistant at a restaurant.

She needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing candy.

Sandra dreams of having her own house built and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en:
Tamella H. is a 57-year-old woman who has been engaged in a poultry business for the last 10 years. She is married and has four children. She has dedicated her life to bringing up her children and providing them with quality higher education.

The poultry business is not as easy as it might seem at first sight. Tamella works from early morning till late at night in order to raise good chickens. Tamella chose this business because it is very popular and people come to her and purchase at least one or two chickens every day. She is applying for a $2000 US loan in order to purchase about 150 chickens to expand her business and increase her income. She believes that with the help of this loan she could sell more than five chickens a day.

loans.use: To purchase 150 chickens

loans.name: Luchando Contra La Pobreza Group

texts.en:
Lucia M. R. started her business two years ago with her first Esperanza loan. She opened a colmado out of the side of her house. In the Dominican Republic, a colmado is a small, neighborhood general store. Lucia sells several staple food items such as rice, dried beans, cookies and crackers as well as razors, toilet paper and other daily necessities. Her business has been very successful, and she is now on her third Ezperanza loan.

Lucia's business has helped put her two children through college. She has a son, age 25, and a daughter, age 23. She is enthusiastic about the success of her business and plans to continue to expand her business as much as possible. The community she lives in loves the convenience of having a colmado in the neighborhood. Lucia is now a group leader for Esperanza and her story provides encouragement to all the women in her loan group.

loans.use: Inventory for a colmado

loans.name: Lourdes Del Rosario

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Lourdes es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, estudia secretariado computarizado y es cosmetóloga brinda servicios a domicilio, Lourdes junto a su hermano tienen un negocio familiar, un restaurante llamado Cebicheria Pejesapo, con la especialidad de mariscos y pescados, actividad que realizan en un local alquilado y con personal que ayudan.
Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tintes, champú y reacondicionares.
Los sueños de Lourdes son tener una peluquería propia, culminar sus estudios y ejercer.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Violeta Microfinance Institute.

She is a 38-year-old married mother with 3 children. She is currently studying keyboarding, and she is a cosmetologist who offers in-home services. Lourdes and her brother have a family business—a restaurant called Cebicheria Pejesapo—specializing in fish and other seafood. They run this business in a rented space and have staff that help them out.

She needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing hair dye, shampoos, and conditioners.

Lourdes dreams of having her own hair salon, as well as finishing her studies and practicing her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hair dye, shampoo, and conditioner

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. sells yams. She prepares and sells them on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies other retailers and food vendors. Beatrice buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for twelve years. Beatrice wants a loan to buy tubers of yam in bulk.

Beatrice is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children-- three sons and one daughter. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Her husband works with a cocoa marketing company. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Beatrice wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam

loans.name: Kateba Group

texts.en:
This is John K., Kaday S. and Adamsay K.. They are business people based in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone.

John K. (middle) is the leader of this group. John is 46 years of age. He was born in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have five children. Some of the children are in secondary school and the others are in primary school. John is a tailor and has been in this business for over 30 years now. With this loan, he will be able to buy material, especially cotton, which he will sew.

This group is called Kateba. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a meaningful impact on the businesses and personal lives of these people. Their businesses have grown, both in size and in quality. They have been able to pay their children’s school fees and other school-related charges as well as feed their families and meet most of their daily financial needs.

loans.use: Invest in tailoring business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Alejandra es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa, Alejandra tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en genera, verduras, carnes, además venD. comida en el mismo local.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo D. 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Los sueños D. Alejandra son mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the Violeta cooperative bank. Alejandra is married, 36 years old, has 2 children, and lives in the Huayllapampa community. Alejandra has a store in her house where she sells groceries such as vegetables, meats, and she also sells food in the same location. Alejandra needs a loan of 1,400 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and cooking oil. Alejandra’s dreams are to improve her business and proviD. a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad M. is 56 years old. He is married and has three sons. 

Mahammad sells cattle. As a rule he purchases calves in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

Having been in this business for eight years he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to raise them and look after them. He gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a considerable and stable income for his large family. 

Mahammad is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase more cattle. For this purpose he requests a $2000 loan that he will use to purchase four calves. You can play an important part in Mahammad’s family's life and he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves to raise

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is 44 years old. She is married and has four children—a son and three daughters. One is in the university and the others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the Western Region and a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Ama is a hard working woman. Her husband works with a timber firm. She sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, and so forth in a store on the street. Ama has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora K. is 47 years old. She is married and has given birth to 10 children, two sons and eight daughters. All are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dora sells vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages, and so forth on a tabletop in the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. Dora also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
Zarifa  B. is 47 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married, and is the loving mother of three children. She started her business 10 years ago.

Now Zarifa dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle.  With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Zarifa is seeking a 2000 USD loan to buy more calves, which she will sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to grow her earnings substantially and to improve her family's quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's request.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. is 55 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the Western Region and a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hard working woman. Ama sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, and so forth in a store on the street. She has been in business for six years, and she wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Fanny Mercedes

texts.es: Fanny Mercedes F. Jiménez, tiene 29 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos,  no posee escolaridad alguna. Igual que otras mujeres trabajadoras y madre esforzada, trabaja de forma independiente comercializando mercadería varias entre estas: ropa, calzado, ropa interior, perfumes, cremas. Su forma de ofrecer sus productos es de manera ambulante entregando a sus clientes la mercadería con formas de pago accesibles, ya sean mensuales o quincenales. Ella adquiere los productos de venta en Managua esto implica viajar muchos kilómetros hacia la capital. Anteriormente ella ha recibido financiamiento de parte de la Fundación y esto le ha hecho mejorar su negocio es por eso que tiene la voluntad de continuar trabajando con nosotros, para poder crecer aun mas y así mejorar su nivel de vida. Sus metas radican en poder crecer como comerciante y así establecerse en el mercado de manera más formal  y adquirir más conocimiento en su trabajo para mejorar su financiamiento.
texts.en:
Fanny Mercedes F. Jiménez is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She does not have any formal education whatsoever. Like other hard-working mothers, she works independently selling a variety of merchandise such as: clothing, shoes, underwear, perfumes and creams. She distributes her products by hand to her customers, offering them flexible payment options such as monthly or bi-monthly. She buys her products in Managua, which involves a trip of many kilometers to the capital city. She had previously received financial assistance from Fundación, and this allowed her to make improvements to her business. She has a wish to continue working with us, to grow her enterprise even more, and therefore elevate her standard of living. Her goals are to grow as a merchant and establish herself in the market in a more formal manner. She also wants to learn more about business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid R. is a hard-working man who has made sure from a young age that his family never goes without its daily bread. He is single and responsible for his elderly parents and younger brothers and sisters. Khalid has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. Khalid began this enterprise 4 years ago with starting capital of 100 USD, and with perseverance and dedication.

Over time, he has expanded his business.  Today, his whole family is engaged in the business.  Khalid now needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his inventory. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan of 2000 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs to increase his store's inventory

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. has eight children--two sons and six daughters. all of whom are in school. She is 40 years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. She is a fish monger who sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies fish to other retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Masala Group

texts.en:
Here are Mohamed T., Fatmata M., Jane C., Ibrahim S., and Zainab C.. They are small-scale business people in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group Masala. This will be their fourth loan from SMT/Kiva. With previous loans, these business people were able to expand their businesses and increase their profit margins, consequently improving their standard of living. They were able to provide their children with three meals a day, send them to school, and meet most of their daily financial challenges. 

Mohamed T. (second from left) is the leader of this group. Mohamed is 38 years of age. He was born in Makeni where he currently resides together with his wife who is also a businesswoman. The two have five children, two of whom are in secondary school, two in primary school, and the last is still very young. Mohamed sells baking soda, garlic, onions, and vegetable oil. He has been a businessman for over ten years. With this loan, he will travel to neighboring Guinea, where the goods he sells are relatively cheaper to buy.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 55 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, two sons and five daughters. Some are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Mary is a trader. She trades in food items such tilapia, salted fish, etc. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She wants a loan to buy fish and other ingredients in bulk. Mary buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Coming from an area where cattle-raising is popular, Elkhan  A. has been selling cattle since 1998.  Elkhan, who is married and the father of two sons, buys cows in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few cows and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. 

Today, Elkhan would like to expand his business by increasing his capital, so that he can maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase young cattle. This will be his first loan with IMON International, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

loans.use: To purchase four cows

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta A. is 20 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her mother in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Alberta is a fishmonger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. Alberta buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes the fish herself. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en:
Shafiga A. is 58 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of four sons. From the time she was a little girl, her father's hard and demanding character showed her the value of work, and as a result she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. 

Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle.  With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and her best friends. 

Shafiga is seeking a 2000 USD loan to buy more young cattle to sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, she will be able to grow her earnings substantially and to improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's request.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Marcelino Alexander

texts.es: Marcelino Alexander E. tiene la edad de 37 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que dedica a es brindar el servicio de taller de carpintería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio inicio con los ingresos del trabajo que poseía anteriormente, ya que el se instruyó en una carpintería de sus tías, por lo que Marcelino con su propio esfuerzo decide establecer su propia carpintería, a pesar que enfrento dificultades como lo fue la compra de todas las herramientas necesarias para su taller, pero esto no desanimo a Marcelino para seguir adelante. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de maderas, clavos, pega para la elaboración de sillas, camas, escritorios, mesas entre otras cosas. El sueño de Marcelino es obtener más ingresos para proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación.
texts.en:
Marcelino Alexander E. is 37 years old and married. He has 2 children under his care. He has been working as a carpenter for the past 15 years.

He started this business with income from a previous job. Marcelino learned this trade in his aunt’s carpentry shop but he decided to work hard and establish his own business despite difficulties like purchasing the necessary tools for his workshop. This difficulty did not discourage him from moving forward.

The loan will be used as working capital to purchase wood, nails, and glue to make chairs, beds, desks, and tables, among other things. Marcelino’s dream is to increase his income so he can provide his children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tamtaneh Group

texts.en:
Here are Amed K., Bakarr K. and Mabinty Koroma of the Tamtaneh group. They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With previous loans, they were able to expand their businesses, make a better profit and improve on their standard of living. Having repaid the previous loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 900,000 for each to further strengthen their businesses.

Amed K. is the leader of the Tamtaneh group. Amed, age 36, was born in Kambia town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children. One of his children is in secondary school and the others are in primary school. Amed sells jewelry including locally made chains. He has been this business for seven years now.

loans.use: Improve the business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes G. is divorced with six children. Two are currently in school and the rest are working. She lives with the children at Sefwi Dwenase, which is a suburb of Sefwi Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. Agnes works very hard because the family responsibility of the kids rests on her shoulders as a mother who wants to see her kids to the expected level of life. She is now 52 years old. She has been selling home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates for seven years. She makes her sales at the community market. Agnes is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to support her children's education. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She would be very grateful for that support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Success’.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Reina Maria

texts.es: Reina María S. Céspedes tiene la edad de 38 años, madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo. su  actividad económica es el comercio de ropa nueva  desde hace más de seis años que se dedica a este negocio. Surge por la necesidad de poseer una fuente de ingresos para su familia y poder sustentarse. Sus dos hijos de diferentes edades el mayor veinte años y siete años el menor, no asisten a la escuela debido a la falta de ingresos económicos.  La solicitud del crédito será utilizada para capital de trabajo, para comprar ropa nueva, perfumes, pantalones, camisas y cosméticos. Ella ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante, la mercadería entre sus clientes que son amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo. Reina S. anteriormente ha recibido préstamos de parte de la Fundación, mejorando su  forma de vida y sus ingresos de esta forma ha podido subsistir durante este tiempo. Como cualquier persona tiene aspiraciones y su meta es tener un negocio propio y ser ella misma su jefe.
texts.en:
Reina María S. Céspedes is 38 years old, and a single mother of two. Her business is the sale of new clothes, and she has been in business for more than six years. She works because of a need to have a source of income for her family and to be able to sustain herself. Her children, the older twenty years old and the younger seven years old, do not attend school because of a lack of income. Reina's loan will be used for working capital, to purchase new clothing, perfumes, pants, shirts and cosmetics. She offers her products door-to-door among her customers, who are friends, family and co-workers. Reina S. has received prior loans from Fundación, and improving her lifestyle and her income in this way has allowed her to subsist during this time. Like anyone, Reina has aspirations, and her goal is to have her own business and be her own boss.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Esiata

texts.en: Esiata is a 35-year-old local restaurant operator. She is divorced and the mother of four who are currently in school. She prepares and sells local foods like banku with soup and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grain and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Esiata has been in business for the last thirteen years. She is working very hard to provide for the educational needs of the children. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance. She is a member of the community group called ‘Success’. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Second Hand Clothing Group

texts.en:
This is Joseph M. B., John K., Pa Mohamed K. and Safie K.. They call their group Second Hand Clothing, named after their businesses. They are business people in Makeni, selling second-hand clothes. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a lot of meaningful impacts on the lives and businesses of these people. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again asking for a new loan of Le 1,200,000 for each to further strengthen their businesses.

Joseph (left) is the leader of the group. He is age 39 and married with three children. Joseph was born in a village called Loka Masana, in northern Sierra Leone. His wife is a businesswoman too, and their children are still attending school. Joseph has been a businessman for eleven years now, selling second-hand clothes. With this loan, he will be able to buy at least three bales of second-hand clothes. A bale of second-hand clothes is usually sold at Le 360,000 in Freetown.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is single and has no children. Currently she is dependent and lives in a rented apartment.  
She lives in Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a 26-year-old trader who trades in clothing materials. She is a very hardworking young lady who works very hard to cater to herself and her business. She trades in garment cloth and lace materials. This is a business she has done for seven years. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, Millicent buys a few stocks of lace materials and garment cloth and sells through hawking. She sells her goods through hawking and she does that during the market days in the surrounding communities. For this reason she requests loan support to make business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase in bulk lace materials, garment cloths and textiles. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Doduo’, which means plenty.

loans.use: To purchase products in bulk
